commit_message:
Correcting Instruction For Mongodb URI in README.rst

README.rst tells user to refer to
[drivers:message_store:mongodb] instead of
[driver:storage:mongodb] and change URI under that section
Previous instruction was unclear for new users.

Change-Id: I5b3254fe3ceb3518cbdcef3fa91802c11eb19358
Closes-Bug: #1407218

commit_message:
iniset_rpc_backend default section

iniset_rpc_backend should know what section it needs to set the
config options in better than the callers. The config options
have actually been moved to different sections and the options
in the DEFAULT section are deprecated.

Change-Id: I0e07fe03c7812ef8df49e126bf71c57588635639

commit_message:
Decorator Function to validate uuids in Redis Drivers

Implements a decorator function to validate UUIDs. Added an
error to be raised if uuid invalid. Wrapped decorator around
driver methods.

Change-Id: I2b5e1e41c44807fb6a5c87b5ddbadbd6acaabdee
Closes-Bug: #1367024

commit_message:
Update "Ironic as a standalone service" documentation

This patch is adding a reminder on the "Using Ironic as a standalone
service" section pointing out that this feature will not work with
versions prior to Kilo. This is intended to avoid confusion for people
using stable branchs.

Change-Id: I9f0451dd19e5d6c5134686f6b9c7aadc8b8d48e7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-21 20:08:52.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py'], 'message': "Clone from git.o.o rather than review.o.o

New version of git running on review.o.o does not work with shallow
clones.  But we shouldn't be cloning from review.o.o anyway.  Use
the more robust git.o.o instead.

Change-Id: I4a9b4dd9da5d52e39373bee0462abaee13c462ce

commit_message:
Clone from git.o.o rather than review.o.o

New version of git running on review.o.o does not work with shallow
clones.  But we shouldn't be cloning from review.o.o anyway.  Use
the more robust git.o.o instead.

Change-Id: I4a9b4dd9da5d52e39373bee0462abaee13c462ce

commit_message:
Set compute-feature-enabled.preserve_ports=True in tempest.conf

Because of branchless Tempest we have to set a compute-feature-enabled
flag to test preserving preexisting ports from Neutron since the code
only works starting in Kilo and won't be backported to stable/juno or
stable/icehouse.

We can remove this flag once juno-eol happens.

Depends-On: I95469e4c2f4aa2bc4e6342860a9c222fb4fa7e16

Related-Bug: #1431724

Change-Id: I214baa3b861e29bedf6bb7b50534ac2286676dd1

commit_message:
delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Closes-Bug: #1368661

Change-Id: Idf3a46d8c95806f2d2ce28ce84ced12b625e53df
(cherry picked from commit a2530ed1e3c59c9bae5cab48222eb69d7e35ca98)

subject: Fix failures when calling list operations using Python binding
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 864, 'name': 'Gavin Brebner', 'email': 'gavin.brebner@hp.com', 'username': 'gavin-brebner-orange'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 14535, 'name': 'Amit Saha', 'email': 'amsaha@gmail.com', 'username': 'amsaha'}, {'_account_id': 15237, 'name': 'Anand Shanmugam', 'email': 'anand1712@gmail.com', 'username': 'anand1712'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-20 18:48:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/client.py', 'neutronclient/v2_0/client.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_securitygroup.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_network.py'], 'message': 'Fix failures when calling list operations using Python binding

This bug is caused because of the regression caused by
I1b719bed406b83c5f2deac06e127798a91f51ad7 . The original bug was
raised because check_max_uri was not working after the introduction
of sessionclient.  The change created a regression in which the
python bindings of the neutron client was not usable and causing
traces.

The fix is to revert the change id and add a new check_max_uri to
the sessionclient.  Now uri length will be checked in sessionclient
and  httpclient as well.  please see bug for further info.

Closes-Bug: #1431449

Change-Id: Ief2352a90bb75a76e8c671d51beb0fb7a53a22f9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failures when calling list operations using Python binding

This bug is caused because of the regression caused by
I1b719bed406b83c5f2deac06e127798a91f51ad7 . The original bug was
raised because check_max_uri was not working after the introduction
of sessionclient.  The change created a regression in which the
python bindings of the neutron client was not usable and causing
traces.

The fix is to revert the change id and add a new check_max_uri to
the sessionclient.  Now uri length will be checked in sessionclient
and  httpclient as well.  please see bug for further info.

Closes-Bug: #1431449

Change-Id: Ief2352a90bb75a76e8c671d51beb0fb7a53a22f9

commit_message:
Remove error messages from multipath command output before parsing

This fixes an issue in _get_multipath_device_name() that fails to
parse the output from 'multipath -ll <device>' command when the
stdout contains error messages in addition to the expected output.

Change-Id: I498edd950627daca01eaf6343e6d742440ca4b04
Related-Bug: #1380742
Closes-Bug: #1433202

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 18:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Return updated volume object to the caller of _attach_volume()

Currently, migrate volume between two back-ends using LIO scsi
target fails due to the error of "Unable to terminate volume
connection: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split'".

The root cause of this error is _detach_volume() during volume
migration does not use updated volume object which is updated
during _attach_volume() by create_export().
As a result terminate_connection() which is called from
_detach_volume() tries to split volume['provider_location']
even if the entry is None and causes above error.

Also same error would be happened following methods.

- copy_volume_data(-> volume migration)
- backup_volume
- restore_backup
- copy_image_to_volume
- copy_volume_to_image

This change adds updated volume as an additional return value
for _attach_volume().

Change-Id: I7b76941d8b2e761c2c0147b13a201583d7e0a1c4
Closes-Bug: #1433360
'}]
commit_message:
Return updated volume object to the caller of _attach_volume()

Currently, migrate volume between two back-ends using LIO scsi
target fails due to the error of "Unable to terminate volume
connection: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split'".

The root cause of this error is _detach_volume() during volume
migration does not use updated volume object which is updated
during _attach_volume() by create_export().
As a result terminate_connection() which is called from
_detach_volume() tries to split volume['provider_location']
even if the entry is None and causes above error.

Also same error would be happened following methods.

- copy_volume_data(-> volume migration)
- backup_volume
- restore_backup
- copy_image_to_volume
- copy_volume_to_image

This change adds updated volume as an additional return value
for _attach_volume().

Change-Id: I7b76941d8b2e761c2c0147b13a201583d7e0a1c4
Closes-Bug: #1433360

commit_message:
Properly handle embedded newlines in csv

When parsing the response from the OpenStack client values (like
keystone tenant descriptions) can have embedded newline. To avoid this
issue, we drop lines that don't start with a double quoted value until
the first one we find.

Change-Id: Ie952161b503d2c46637e6a6e1c83b2dfce1c03a7

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-18 16:05:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_san.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/san.py'], 'message': 'Fix SAN generic driver ssh whitespaced commands

SAN driver was sending commands over ssh with whitespaces between
every character resulting in commands like "u n a m e - s" instead
of "uname -s" (example from bug report).

As the bug reporter noted, the problem was that there were two joins
in the process of mounting the command. The first one got the
tuple and joined into a string. The second one joined a whitespace
between each character of the string.

Additionally, this behavior made utils.ssh_injection a bad check,
because it expected a list of args used in 'for arg in cmd_list' and
what it got was a single string. This resulted in the check being made
over the single characters instead of each arg.

All this is to explain why I chose to remove the first join instead of
the second one.

An unit test for this issue was created. SAN driver had no unit test.

Change-Id: I8e8624f2b82c26522936adf05e637a7bbe34a069
Closes-Bug: #1422604
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SAN generic driver ssh whitespaced commands

SAN driver was sending commands over ssh with whitespaces between
every character resulting in commands like "u n a m e - s" instead
of "uname -s" (example from bug report).

As the bug reporter noted, the problem was that there were two joins
in the process of mounting the command. The first one got the
tuple and joined into a string. The second one joined a whitespace
between each character of the string.

Additionally, this behavior made utils.ssh_injection a bad check,
because it expected a list of args used in 'for arg in cmd_list' and
what it got was a single string. This resulted in the check being made
over the single characters instead of each arg.

All this is to explain why I chose to remove the first join instead of
the second one.

An unit test for this issue was created. SAN driver had no unit test.

Change-Id: I8e8624f2b82c26522936adf05e637a7bbe34a069
Closes-Bug: #1422604

Uncomment all removed Cinder drivers

As announced recently cinder has removed all drivers that have no CI setup.

Announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-March/059384.html

Disable the driver documentation in the Config Reference for now to
easily add them back if a CI gets setup for Liberty.

commit_message:
Set 0644 mode for ntp and dnsmasq services

Set 0644 mode for ntp and dnsmasq services, because
they can potentially break work of corosync resources.
You cannot start services by using /etc/init.d/ link
for these services now.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5935f1230e98eddfe4a73d0ce1cb9b5c23df40f5
Closes-Bug: 1431357

subject: Remove warnings from openstack responses
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-20 15:29:30.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'message': "Remove warnings from openstack responses

Puppet's `commands` and `has_command` methods are not able to separate
stdout and stderr. When the openstack command prints out unexpected
warnings that have no bearing on our computation, we need to ignore it,
otherwise the CSV module will fail to parse it. This patch filters the
total response produced by the openstack command into only lines that
match a CSV-like regular expression with at least two fields.

If a legitimate error is produced that causes the command to return
failure, puppet catches it during the command execution and raises a
Puppet::Execution error, so this change will not affect its ability to
detect legitimate failures and report on them.

Change-Id: I4f3a8b1ddf6b06dcbf194dd66408c71d4da6d861
(cherry picked from commit 24effa1e360b1eacec7fbfdfed339ba6e639f7fd)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove warnings from openstack responses

Puppet's `commands` and `has_command` methods are not able to separate
stdout and stderr. When the openstack command prints out unexpected
warnings that have no bearing on our computation, we need to ignore it,
otherwise the CSV module will fail to parse it. This patch filters the
total response produced by the openstack command into only lines that
match a CSV-like regular expression with at least two fields.

If a legitimate error is produced that causes the command to return
failure, puppet catches it during the command execution and raises a
Puppet::Execution error, so this change will not affect its ability to
detect legitimate failures and report on them.

Change-Id: I4f3a8b1ddf6b06dcbf194dd66408c71d4da6d861
(cherry picked from commit 24effa1e360b1eacec7fbfdfed339ba6e639f7fd)

This patch will assign default value of gpfs_images_share_mode
option used in gpfs.py to None instead of 'copy_on_write'.
Initializing it with 'copy_on_write' breaks the setup. It is
needed only if the user configures gpfs_images_dir option.

Change-Id: I73e91f7d41fa97a8b2f05dac55c665d1f6dedf07
Closes-Bug: #1427713
"}]
commit_message:
Change default value of gpfs_images_share_mode to None

This patch will assign default value of gpfs_images_share_mode
option used in gpfs.py to None instead of 'copy_on_write'.
Initializing it with 'copy_on_write' breaks the setup. It is
needed only if the user configures gpfs_images_dir option.

Change-Id: I73e91f7d41fa97a8b2f05dac55c665d1f6dedf07
Closes-Bug: #1427713

commit_message:
Sync with latest oslo-incubator

Changes are as follows:
f29e865 3/17/15  Store ProcessLauncher signal handlers on class level
bf92010 2/19/15  Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher
2aacb11 1/29/15  Change oslo.config to oslo_config
2fbf506 1/29/15  Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
0cc741a 1/26/15  switch to oslo_i18n
fbd77a7 1/21/15  Allow overriding name for periodic tasks
9896e0e 1/21/15  Separate add_periodic_task from the metaclass __init__
80c4751 1/5/15   Remove unnecessary import of eventlet
442fc22 12/30/14 Added graceful argument on Service.stop method
cf429e5 12/28/14 Remove extra white space in log message
5985b35 12/11/14 Prefer delayed %r formatting over explicit repr use

Closes-bug: #1434744
Change-Id: Icf0b52170b3457d570fd87fd2875a1e759b97579

This will be wrapped into a service to be launched standalone.

commit_message:
Rename and move the v2.1 api policy into separated files

This patch rename the v2.1 api policy with 'os_compute_api' prefix,
that used to distinguish with v2 and ec2 API. And also move all
v2.1 api policy rule out of policy.conf.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Depends-On: Iec23b095176332414faf76a9c329f8bb5f3aa6c3

Change-Id: Id8e1e84cd3717dfd0a3b3f80acec50f96c205251

commit_message:

sanity check.

EMC: Fix use of "_" as variable name

Variables with name "_" will clash with translation lookup
function "_" in cinder.i18n. This patch fixes usage of "_"
as variable name.

subject: Ensure thread-safety of persistence dir backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 23:20:25.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_memory.py', 'taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_dir.py'], 'message': 'Ensure thread-safety of persistence dir backend

Even though this backend is protected by process locks
against other processes we still need to protect against
threads in the same process; so to do this grab a write
lock and use it in the same manner that the memory backend
does; as a per-backend write-lock.

Change-Id: Ifb86631033aad1ca622be9cf3c3677293d8c56bd
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure thread-safety of persistence dir backend

Even though this backend is protected by process locks
against other processes we still need to protect against
threads in the same process; so to do this grab a write
lock and use it in the same manner that the memory backend
does; as a per-backend write-lock.

Change-Id: Ifb86631033aad1ca622be9cf3c3677293d8c56bd

subject: Use binary/encode decode helper routines in dir backend
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-19 04:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_dir.py'], 'message': 'Use binary/encode decode helper routines in dir backend

Instead of using smaller versions of those routines just
call into the same helper routines that the rest of the
code uses.

This also allows that backend to take a configuration
option that specifies the encoding that will be used for
when translating unicode strings into binary (and vice
versa); this defaults to utf-8 to retain the existing
behavior.

Change-Id: Icfcbb22310e163753d8b34af212efc166c82634b
'}]
commit_message:
Use binary/encode decode helper routines in dir backend

Instead of using smaller versions of those routines just
call into the same helper routines that the rest of the
code uses.

This also allows that backend to take a configuration
option that specifies the encoding that will be used for
when translating unicode strings into binary (and vice
versa); this defaults to utf-8 to retain the existing
behavior.

Change-Id: Icfcbb22310e163753d8b34af212efc166c82634b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 12:44:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py'], 'message': "Reduce configured file size for nfs backup unit tests

Unit tests that were ported from the Swift backup
service for NFS backup trigger memory errors when
run in tox on a 1GB VM.  This commit configures
NFS backup 'backup_file_size' to match the default
Swift 'chunk_size' so that the NFS backup unit test
memory consumption is dialed down to match the Swift
unit tests.

Closes-Bug: 1432687

Change-Id: I4b71d47190179b97baefe9bc390276f720670919
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce configured file size for nfs backup unit tests

Unit tests that were ported from the Swift backup
service for NFS backup trigger memory errors when
run in tox on a 1GB VM.  This commit configures
NFS backup 'backup_file_size' to match the default
Swift 'chunk_size' so that the NFS backup unit test
memory consumption is dialed down to match the Swift
unit tests.

Closes-Bug: 1432687

Add `wait_for_output` and `wait_for_output_unless` helper functions that
only succeed when the command output contains the expected string, with

commit_message:
Fix `wait_for` function in kolla-common.sh

Add `wait_for_output` and `wait_for_output_unless` helper functions that
only succeed when the command output contains the expected string, with
a possibility to exit early with a failure for `wait_for_output_unless`.

Change-Id: Ie20e7c72fb84f626f1a3fe9c4d2f22c9d6863dbe

subject: Refactors nwfilter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 22:04:30.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova-compute/nova-libvirt/Dockerfile', 'docker/nova-compute/nova-compute/Dockerfile', 'compose/nova-compute-network.yml'], 'message': "Refactors nwfilter

Previously, the nwfilter daemon/conf pkgs would need to be
installed on the host. Compose would then mount the host DIR
to the compute containers. A more efficient approach is to simply
install the nwfilter config/daemon in the libvirt container. Both
appoaches address the following error when booting an instance:

'no-mac-spoofing' is missing

Change-Id: I81b446d198920473bf99b97ef5eac6ef5ee85024
"}]
commit_message:
Refactors nwfilter

Previously, the nwfilter daemon/conf pkgs would need to be
installed on the host. Compose would then mount the host DIR
to the compute containers. A more efficient approach is to simply
install the nwfilter config/daemon in the libvirt container. Both
appoaches address the following error when booting an instance:

'no-mac-spoofing' is missing

Change-Id: I81b446d198920473bf99b97ef5eac6ef5ee85024

subject: Add pid: host to libvirt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-20 17:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['docs/developer-env.md', 'compose/nova-compute-network.yml'], 'message': "Add pid: host to libvirt

Without pid: host, nova-compute and libvirt fail to operate correctly
together.  I don't understand why, and I wish it weren't so, but it means
folks will have to install docker-compose from my personal github account
until the pull request is merged upstream.

Change-Id: I24e55405139c831f2df246f54c5b6fd39d00656a
"}]
commit_message:
Add pid: host to libvirt

Without pid: host, nova-compute and libvirt fail to operate correctly
together.  I don't understand why, and I wish it weren't so, but it means
folks will have to install docker-compose from my personal github account
until the pull request is merged upstream.

Change-Id: I24e55405139c831f2df246f54c5b6fd39d00656a

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: I172439c6ed185bb38b325b2524cab1475cdc7504
'}]
commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: I172439c6ed185bb38b325b2524cab1475cdc7504

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint Implement a database container set

Previously, the database container was configured for use with
Kubernetes. This patch removed any k8s dependencies, adds a script
to manage mysql server.cnf settings and splits data and app
containers. Splitting the containers provides additional
portability and operational efficiencies compared to host mounts.

Change-Id: I80656450c02dda5f2959d187eec20d5877dc54a2

subject: Avoid re-using the same timeout for further watcher ops
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 01:48:08.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "Avoid re-using the same timeout for further watcher ops

Instead of re-using the same timeout that is passed into the
'run_watchers' function we should adjust that timeout after
each fetch so that the expected timeout the user gives to this
function is observed.

Change-Id: I5d171b1ac8b207213224f4e0f3909625de7275db
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid re-using the same timeout for further watcher ops

Instead of re-using the same timeout that is passed into the
'run_watchers' function we should adjust that timeout after
each fetch so that the expected timeout the user gives to this
function is observed.

Change-Id: I5d171b1ac8b207213224f4e0f3909625de7275db

subject: [Launch Instance Fix] Remove outline from basic search bar
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 18:44:46.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/angular/table/table.scss', 'horizon/static/angular/table/search-bar.html'], 'message': "[Launch Instance Fix] Remove outline from basic search bar

A name collision with Magic Search resulted in an outline
around the basic search bar in Launch Instance steps. This
patch renames the class for the basic search bar to
'basic-search-bar'.

Change-Id: If1676a7f78a4d7d9566aef853d58871b60b1a803
Closes-Bug: #1434661
"}]
commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Remove outline from basic search bar

A name collision with Magic Search resulted in an outline
around the basic search bar in Launch Instance steps. This
patch renames the class for the basic search bar to
'basic-search-bar'.

Change-Id: If1676a7f78a4d7d9566aef853d58871b60b1a803
Closes-Bug: #1434661

subject: Fix an issue on updating bay's node_count on DB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 22:20:59.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/conductor/handlers/test_bay_k8s_heat.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_k8s_heat.py'], 'message': "Fix an issue on updating bay's node_count on DB

When using bay-update to scale the cluster, the node_count attribute of
bay doesn't get updated at DB. This is due to the 'delta' of Bay object
being unexpected removed. This patch is for fixing that by creating a
copy of delta.

Change-Id: Ia42f9a793fb94ee66c8a1cb1a72ef3061a4491bb
Closes-Bug: 1434145
"}]
commit_message:
Fix an issue on updating bay's node_count on DB

When using bay-update to scale the cluster, the node_count attribute of
bay doesn't get updated at DB. This is due to the 'delta' of Bay object
being unexpected removed. This patch is for fixing that by creating a
copy of delta.

Change-Id: Ia42f9a793fb94ee66c8a1cb1a72ef3061a4491bb
Closes-Bug: 1434145

Closes-Bug: #1433543
Change-Id: If49fd9229f08301cedbd63399fe46475e73a83ef

commit_message:
Add retry to create resource in Datera driver

If the volume is still in a creating state, wait, and retry a few times.
Otherwise, raise an exception for the manager to set the volume into an
error state.

Closes-Bug: #1433543
Change-Id: If49fd9229f08301cedbd63399fe46475e73a83ef

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-17 19:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/wsgi.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "Bypass paste.deploy's loadcontext to read a config from a string

We need a good way to make a default config internal client work on
upgrades without a config on disk.  This would work until we can get
a patch upstream against paste.deploy that will accept a URI
object.

Change-Id: Ibeeb354bf67ef978aba99ac416aa9d10016b9893
"}]
commit_message:
Bypass paste.deploy's loadcontext to read a config from a string

We need a good way to make a default config internal client work on
upgrades without a config on disk.  This would work until we can get
a patch upstream against paste.deploy that will accept a URI
object.

Change-Id: Ibeeb354bf67ef978aba99ac416aa9d10016b9893

subject: Improve create instance without volume service
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-02 20:57:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'Improve create instance without volume service

Currently an error notification is raised when creating an instance
on an OpenStack deployment without volume service.

This change avoids the error notification as volume service is not
required to boot an instance.

Change-Id: I1dd601e7746dfdedc7568c1f3ba0036b327da18e
Closes-Bug: #1427261
'}]
commit_message:
Improve create instance without volume service

Currently an error notification is raised when creating an instance
on an OpenStack deployment without volume service.

This change avoids the error notification as volume service is not
required to boot an instance.

Change-Id: I1dd601e7746dfdedc7568c1f3ba0036b327da18e
Closes-Bug: #1427261

commit_message:
Fix oslo caps for kilo

The ~= syntax isn't working with some of our tools (notably the job that
syncs the changes into projects), so switch back to expressing the range
the long way.

Change-Id: Ib9e3815f5bf5608ca9252fa1bfce099adb5869bc

subject: Move pylint dependency to tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 16:14:49.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move pylint dependency to tox.ini

We do not run a gate job against oslo.vmware using pylint, so move the
dependency out of the synced requirements and into the tox environment
settings instead. If that's no longer useful, we can remove the tox
environment completely.

Change-Id: Ice3527b8d92137d04fd77e7e800a5875fa7fdaf2
"}]
commit_message:
Move pylint dependency to tox.ini

We do not run a gate job against oslo.vmware using pylint, so move the
dependency out of the synced requirements and into the tox environment
settings instead. If that's no longer useful, we can remove the tox
environment completely.

Change-Id: Ice3527b8d92137d04fd77e7e800a5875fa7fdaf2

The source step of the Launch Instance Wizard contains a transfer
table which is dynamic in nature. The table's column headers and data
change based on the boot source that is selected. This patch fixes

based on the latest Invision mockups (where valid).

commit_message:
Source step - fix dynamic column headers and data

The source step of the Launch Instance Wizard contains a transfer
table which is dynamic in nature. The table's column headers and data
change based on the boot source that is selected. This patch fixes
the column headers and data mapping when a boot source is selected,
based on the latest Invision mockups (where valid).

Closes-Bug: 1432883

Change-Id: I2dd5d246471d12dd7a8c5287f1e5a6093a3c196f

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-18 00:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/decom.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/clean.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/clean.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ironic_python_agent/errors.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/decom.py'], 'message': 'Add cleaning/zapping support to IPA

This will add support for in band cleaning operations to IPA and

Adds API support for get_clean_steps, which returns a list of
supported clean steps for the node, execute_clean_step, to execute
one of the steps returned by get_clean_steps.

Adds versioning and naming for hardware managers, so if a new hardware

blueprint implement-cleaning-states
blueprint inband-raid-configuration
blueprint implement-zaping-states
Depends-On: Ia2500ed5afb72058b4c5e8f41307169381cbce48
Change-Id: I750b80b9bf98b3ddc5643bb4c14a67d2052239af
'}]
commit_message:
Add cleaning/zapping support to IPA

This will add support for in band cleaning operations to IPA and
replace the decom API that was unused.

Adds API support for get_clean_steps, which returns a list of
supported clean steps for the node, execute_clean_step, to execute
one of the steps returned by get_clean_steps.

Adds versioning and naming for hardware managers, so if a new hardware
manager version is deployed in the middle of cleaning/zapping, the
cleaning/zapping will be restarted to avoid incompatabilities.

blueprint implement-cleaning-states
blueprint inband-raid-configuration
blueprint implement-zaping-states
Depends-On: Ia2500ed5afb72058b4c5e8f41307169381cbce48
Change-Id: I750b80b9bf98b3ddc5643bb4c14a67d2052239af

subject: Allow baymodel name when bay is created
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 04:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_bay.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/bay.py'], 'message': 'Allow baymodel name when bay is created

Bay needs baymodel id when bay is created. But usually, user want to use
`baymodel name` instead of baymodel id.
This patch supports baymodel name when bay is created.

Eg. magnum bay-create --name bay1 --baymodel-id baymodel-name

Partially implements blueprint name-based-resource-management

Change-Id: I8c042c461d46a251c1cd6772979d77a95b902de5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow baymodel name when bay is created

Bay needs baymodel id when bay is created. But usually, user want to use
`baymodel name` instead of baymodel id.
This patch supports baymodel name when bay is created.

Eg. magnum bay-create --name bay1 --baymodel-id baymodel-name

Partially implements blueprint name-based-resource-management

Change-Id: I8c042c461d46a251c1cd6772979d77a95b902de5

commit_message:
[Tempest]: Try to find py27 interpreter

Since Rally team wants to support all Python 2.6, Python 2.7 and Python 3
envs and based on way of launching tempest(Rally install Tempest in virtual
environment), we can try to find and select a suitable python interpreter
for Tempest(Tempest designed only for Python 2.7). It can allow to support
`rally verify` stuff in all python environments.

Change-Id: If8c94c28119a34e60c00f7ef2cb9b94bc2e62004

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 00:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Backwards compatiblity for auth_token middleware

Global requirements has keystonemiddleware>=1.0.0. But we configure
keystone auth_token with auth plugin which is only available from
1.3. With an older middleware, users will hit unauthorized errors
while stacking. I think we still need to support the legacy config
options until the minimum version is bumped up.

Change-Id: Ica62382ae113d857883c15a308126476a4fe9c9f
'}]
commit_message:
Backwards compatiblity for auth_token middleware

Global requirements has keystonemiddleware>=1.0.0. But we configure
keystone auth_token with auth plugin which is only available from
1.3. With an older middleware, users will hit unauthorized errors
while stacking. I think we still need to support the legacy config
options until the minimum version is bumped up.

Change-Id: Ica62382ae113d857883c15a308126476a4fe9c9f

commit_message:
Break coupling between ML2 and L3 during delete operation

This is an initial attempt at breaking out the L3 logic from the ML2
framework as much as possible. This patch takes care of the notification
to the L3 agent(s), after a port has been deleted. Both base L3 and
L3+DVR operations are affected.

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: Ic41b87246ec4d89c2da49afaaccaeb8bd041dcb9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-19 16:37:08.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh', 'scripts/os-ansible-role-requirements.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect variables in ansible role scripts

Both bootstap-ansible.sh and os-ansible-role-requirements.py had
variables that weren't correct. This change fixes both.

* bootstrap-ansible.sh now checks for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE rather than
hardcoding lookup for `ansible-role-requirements.yml`. For reference,
that file name is the default value for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE.
* os-ansible-role-requirements.py was checking the dirname of
the requirements_file argument directly, which is just a file name, not
a path. The `requirements_file` variable has the full path calculated
from the passed file name.

Change-Id: I2f035bc230b77c9dc4363a60ebe0436970fa8a7e
Closes-Bug: #1434139
Closes-Bug: #1434129
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect variables in ansible role scripts

Both bootstap-ansible.sh and os-ansible-role-requirements.py had
variables that weren't correct. This change fixes both.

* bootstrap-ansible.sh now checks for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE rather than
hardcoding lookup for `ansible-role-requirements.yml`. For reference,
that file name is the default value for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE.
* os-ansible-role-requirements.py was checking the dirname of
the requirements_file argument directly, which is just a file name, not
a path. The `requirements_file` variable has the full path calculated
from the passed file name.

Change-Id: I2f035bc230b77c9dc4363a60ebe0436970fa8a7e
Closes-Bug: #1434139
Closes-Bug: #1434129

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-10 18:00:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_advanced_server_ops.py'], 'message': 'Revert "disable neutron network tests that fail too much"

This reverts commit 41a4ef4c586eec7a540d74b5360566f9263eed3b.

These tests were skipped back in October and we still see
the failures in test_server_connectivity_reboot.

To actually work on fixing this issue, we need to unskip
the tests that hit the failure most often but tie that to
nova changes which debug/fix the problem.

Change-Id: I007ced60a80ddbc04e04822e7575a6dc7083874c
Related-Bug: #1323658
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "disable neutron network tests that fail too much"

This reverts commit 41a4ef4c586eec7a540d74b5360566f9263eed3b.

These tests were skipped back in October and we still see
the failures in test_server_connectivity_reboot.

To actually work on fixing this issue, we need to unskip
the tests that hit the failure most often but tie that to
nova changes which debug/fix the problem.

Change-Id: I007ced60a80ddbc04e04822e7575a6dc7083874c
Related-Bug: #1323658

commit_message:
Translated count filter for table footer

We normally display item count in the table footer. This patch adds a
directive to translate and include item count.

Partially Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables
Change-Id: Iee6d861dd3d283477014c68f728615a1b3ca438c

commit_message:
Reuse nova batch notifier

Refactor the batch notifier currently used by the Nova notifier
into a separate class. It will be reused when batching L3 HA
state change events.

Partially-Implements: blueprint report-ha-router-master
Change-Id: I2f8cf261f48bdb632ac0bd643a337290b5297fce

subject: Add fail_loglevel to processutils.execute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-08 21:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/processutils.py'], 'message': 'Add fail_loglevel to processutils.execute

It is useful to be able to log actual failures at a level like
logging.ERROR while leaving the rest of the logging in execute() at
a lower level, like logging.DEBUG.

This patch adds processing of the fail_loglevel kwarg and defaults
it to the loglevel setting to ensure no behavior change.

Change-Id: I6163e731688bfccc23996b5e7927d33bfd1d08f5
'}]
commit_message:
Add fail_loglevel to processutils.execute

It is useful to be able to log actual failures at a level like
logging.ERROR while leaving the rest of the logging in execute() at
a lower level, like logging.DEBUG.

This patch adds processing of the fail_loglevel kwarg and defaults
it to the loglevel setting to ensure no behavior change.

Change-Id: I6163e731688bfccc23996b5e7927d33bfd1d08f5

Some tests make unnecessary calls to conductor_api.build_instances()
when the tests themself do not depend on instances being built.

This in turn results in threads completely out of control of the tests
that spawned them that generate random errors in logs.

Change-Id: I983f9477efc9c559e3df405c590df31683eef3d7
Partial-Bug: #1371587
'}]
commit_message:
Mock unnecessary calls to conductor_api.build_instances()

Some tests make unnecessary calls to conductor_api.build_instances()
when the tests themself do not depend on instances being built.

This in turn results in threads completely out of control of the tests
that spawned them that generate random errors in logs.

Change-Id: I983f9477efc9c559e3df405c590df31683eef3d7
Partial-Bug: #1371587

commit_message:
Allow plugin to specify security-group rules ids upon creation

This patch enables plugin to specify the security-group rules ids,
it is optional and defaults to current behavior.
This approach is already used with network creation, where a plugin can
specify the network uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1434067
Change-Id: I034f0ffc2200f64926617e87861a97838e76342c

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, spearately from auth_name.
If service_name is not specified, it's value defaults to the value
of auth_name (which maintains the current behavior.)

Change-Id: Ie586b2892c092a9694b067a9e0f28f36396de30d
Closes-bug: #1359755

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

- This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
  puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some just
  catch common errors.

Change-Id: Ic47d53384592637dd27c3d0851fe24861ee1ed81
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make user creation optional when creating service.

In some cases it is useful to be able to just configure
the service in Keystone and not the service user. This
is the case when e.g. a read only LDAP backend is used.
Added a parameter configure_user (defaults to true).

Change-Id: I610c9c238de9a1be0203a9dc5bb8845d3eb753ea
Closes-Bug: 1360232
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to match
auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service name,
spearately from auth_name. If service_name is not specified, it's value
defaults to the value of auth_name (which maintains the current
behavior.)

Change-Id: I4e7e122924ab56702ac325c6574a741ae905c70c
Closes-bug: #1359755
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I169e3255e3f3ef57938861c31ef4e342d9a32cbc

commit_message:
Add ADMIN_USER_PASSWORD to genenv tool

The genenv tool was generating the wrong password for the openrc
file as a result of recent keystone rework.  This patch fixes that
problem.

Change-Id: I169e3255e3f3ef57938861c31ef4e342d9a32cbc

The resource tracker is being converted to use objects. This patch
removes InstanceClaimTestCase.test_claim_and_audit from
test_resource_tracker.py and adds equivalent tests to test_tracker.py.
By doing it this way, it can be seen that the old and new tests both
pass in the gate before the resource tracker is converted to use
migration objects.

Partially implements blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I7682fe86ebdecca10abad0f816e8b0c93cb498c5
'}]
commit_message:
Move InstanceClaimTestCase.test_claim_and_audit

The resource tracker is being converted to use objects. This patch
removes InstanceClaimTestCase.test_claim_and_audit from
test_resource_tracker.py and adds equivalent tests to test_tracker.py.
By doing it this way, it can be seen that the old and new tests both
pass in the gate before the resource tracker is converted to use
migration objects.

Partially implements blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I7682fe86ebdecca10abad0f816e8b0c93cb498c5

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
   puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ida94605916fe26dd4c5fb328f79c4e787d29dcf5
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
   puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ida94605916fe26dd4c5fb328f79c4e787d29dcf5
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-24 21:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Move the assignment of existing_floating_ips before try block

In function _process_external() in agent/l3/agent.py, the call to
iptables_manager.defer_apply() may throw an exception, making a
later call to _update_fip_statuses() use an un-initialized value.
This will throw its own UnboundLocalError, with the result being
no iptables rules will be applied.

Added tests to cover both the defer_apply() code exception
processing, as well as this new case where we might jump to
_update_fip_statuses() without having done any work on floating
IP addresses.

Change-Id: I0045effc9319772127758be4aacca02ab5c236cd
Closes-Bug: #1413111
'}]
commit_message:
Move the assignment of existing_floating_ips before try block

In function _process_external() in agent/l3/agent.py, the call to
iptables_manager.defer_apply() may throw an exception, making a
later call to _update_fip_statuses() use an un-initialized value.
This will throw its own UnboundLocalError, with the result being
no iptables rules will be applied.

Added tests to cover both the defer_apply() code exception
processing, as well as this new case where we might jump to
_update_fip_statuses() without having done any work on floating
IP addresses.

Change-Id: I0045effc9319772127758be4aacca02ab5c236cd
Closes-Bug: #1413111

commit_message:
Rename compute response schema dir to v2_1

This commit rename the compute response schema directory to v2_1.
Further this directory will used to place all merged compute schema files
for V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint rearrange-nova-response-schemas

Change-Id: Ia9d9a147df3668d6dd76f0825676439676b43bee

subject: WIP: Lazy load outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-07 22:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/template.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Lazy load outputs

TODO: tests

This implements lazy loading for outputs, such that the resolving of the
outputs are not done until a key access is required. The internal
representation is no longer translated, rather the outputs class is
passed the expected format for the differing template sections. The new
class tries to unite all output operations including getting elements
and validation.

Change-Id: I0440afbf354c90ce48fe739ae2da7dd150421a8e
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Lazy load outputs

TODO: tests

This implements lazy loading for outputs, such that the resolving of the
outputs are not done until a key access is required. The internal
representation is no longer translated, rather the outputs class is
passed the expected format for the differing template sections. The new
class tries to unite all output operations including getting elements
and validation.

Change-Id: I0440afbf354c90ce48fe739ae2da7dd150421a8e

commit_message:
Disable metadata in cloud-init config

Rather than deleting cloud-init, which is going to take longer, just
disable ec2 metadata service. This will be a no-op on rackspace, which
already does this.

Change-Id: I5e8baee50800f7aae474288a914333c21466855a

commit_message:
Starting to rework docs around the secret resource

This is the start of a reworking of our docs around the
secrets API. There will be a number of follow-up patches
before this document will be considered complete.
Until this document is considered complete, I'm not adding
this page to the table of contents. Also, to limit
individual CR size, I've tossed TODOs on the areas that
will be worked on in future CRs.

Change-Id: I8599628d51f4b5aae9ec1b8fd76f419d5b38bdcc

commit_message:
Fail deploy if root uuid or disk id isn't available

Makes the vendor passthrus pass_deploy_info of pxe
and ilo deploys to fail the deploy if root uuid or
disk id isn't available.

Closes-Bug: 1405519
Change-Id: Icb4771ad4ec2b8a32890e8324a9d23747225a909

commit_message:
Update forge-upload job to use tags

For security, ignore the Rakefile in the repo itself, and replace
with a bare-bones file that can handle module:push.

Also replace the version entry in metadata.json with the contents
of the tag which triggered this run.

Change-Id: I0f5770dd92116cca2bcd6418733fc8faf45e1208

commit_message:
Validate MTU values at network creation

Commit 0225607ab9a9337914891e082adafc6199e0582a added support
for MTU. This patch ensures that the values set are valid.

If not then an exception will be raised and failure will not
occur at the dhcp agent when updating.

Change-Id: I1a14d58dfedd1fe1359a5190fd02395ea2f72bb6

commit_message:
Split grenade out of integrated-gate template

We are currently running grenade jobs on projects that grenade doesn't
test. As the first step to fix this, decouple the 'integrated-gate'
template with running of grenade.

Change-Id: I2f2e0d766735061dbd1f04e0ea63642a8723984b

revisions:

This fix includes a couple of fundamental changes to the way scores
are stored, as well as tweaks to to the reporting code. That
reporting code will be undergoing more optimization soon. Summary
of changes:

- Scores are now stored as a list, grouping score by severity
- report_JSON prototype changed to match other report_XXX functions
- report_JSON now handles the severity level filter
- report_JSON code cleaned up a bit
- "level" value in result_store is now a self value, and no longer

Change-Id: Ie77142cf0ccf6ae32172f476e7662badaee39ebd

commit_message:
Fixed severity level filtering

This fix includes a couple of fundamental changes to the way scores
are stored, as well as tweaks to to the reporting code. That
reporting code will be undergoing more optimization soon. Summary
of changes:

- Scores are now stored as a list, grouping score by severity
- report_JSON prototype changed to match other report_XXX functions
- report_JSON now handles the severity level filter
- report_JSON code cleaned up a bit
- "level" value in result_store is now a self value, and no longer
  passed around pointlessly
- JSON reporting stats now include a summary of issue counts for
  each severity (respects chosen severity filter)

Change-Id: Ie77142cf0ccf6ae32172f476e7662badaee39ebd

commit_message:
Move Pool NS Records to their own table

The provides part 1 of the Pools API changes discussed at the
mid cycle. Th majority of the remaining changes are new code/
objects rather than refactoring - so this change has been
split into it's own review.

Change-Id: I2291d76d36e8fcdeb8dffca855e7292d8cb22bfb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 14:59:49.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/exception.py'], 'message': 'BarbicanHTTPException can take arguments for client_message

The BarbicanHTTPException used to only receive some string for the

Change-Id: I9c78e352b914f5ca6a1e4fa2aa21dedb32aeba92

commit_message:
BarbicanHTTPException can take arguments for client_message

The BarbicanHTTPException used to only receive some string for the
message that would be sent back to the client with the error. This CR
enhances this exception and now you can give several arguments that
will end up formatting that message.

Change-Id: I9c78e352b914f5ca6a1e4fa2aa21dedb32aeba92

changed the auth port from public to admin since keystone user

commit_message:
Fixes Keystone openrc and sets / for scripts

Previously, the keydtone openrc file was not using the proper
auth url, whcih was broken with too many double ticks. Also
changed the auth port from public to admin since keystone user
is an admin tenant. Changed DIR for scripts to align with the
rest of the project.

Change-Id: Iadde3239227e65ecca479b16a7b7db51d3a579c8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-12 20:07:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/rpc/test_dispatcher.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py', 'oslo_messaging/target.py'], 'message': "Add support for multiple namespaces in Targets

In order for projects to use the namespace property of Targets
in a backwards compatible way (To support rolling upgrades),
a Target may now belong to more than a single namespace (i.e.
'namespace1' and None). This way, if the server is upgraded first,
the version that introduces namespaces to a project will place
the server RPC methods in ['some_namespace', None]. Pre-upgrade
agents will send messages in the null namespace while post-upgrade
agents will send messages in 'some_namespace', and both will be
accepted.

Change-Id: I713fe9228111c36aa3f7fb95cbd59c99100e8c96
Closes-Bug: #1430984
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for multiple namespaces in Targets

In order for projects to use the namespace property of Targets
in a backwards compatible way (To support rolling upgrades),
a Target may now belong to more than a single namespace (i.e.
'namespace1' and None). This way, if the server is upgraded first,
the version that introduces namespaces to a project will place
the server RPC methods in ['some_namespace', None]. Pre-upgrade
agents will send messages in the null namespace while post-upgrade
agents will send messages in 'some_namespace', and both will be
accepted.

subject: sqlalchemy: enhance QueryTransformer
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-20 08:45:01.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/indexer/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'sqlalchemy: enhance QueryTransformer

This enhances QueryTransformer in sqlalchemy based on the recent work
that have been done with the QueryMeasure in _carbonara.

It also maps all the indexer exception under a generic IndexerException
query so the REST API can only catch this one and serialize it down to
the client with a 400 error. We know that these exception are not a
problem with the driver, but with the client sending garbage.

Change-Id: I493e8cfcf503329bee92acead14f9c66b475dbde
'}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: enhance QueryTransformer

This enhances QueryTransformer in sqlalchemy based on the recent work
that have been done with the QueryMeasure in _carbonara.

It also maps all the indexer exception under a generic IndexerException
query so the REST API can only catch this one and serialize it down to
the client with a 400 error. We know that these exception are not a
problem with the driver, but with the client sending garbage.

Change-Id: I493e8cfcf503329bee92acead14f9c66b475dbde

commit_message:
make nova boot command match data from prior example

This patches the "Create volume from image and boot instance"
instructions such that the "nova boot" command in step 4 uses an image
id from the "nova image-list" command in step 1.  This will help avoid
confusion as to where exactly that id is coming from.

Change-Id: I9e11851beaa7548cd8c366f3b6d26d318b42e1a8

Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <dklyle0@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Custom Horizon Theme

This patch is to propose the workflow of customizing Horizon theme
easily.

Currently Horizon relies on DjangoScssFilter to preprocess all the scss
files. The css styles such as color and font are mostly controlled by
the variables specified in the the scss files (_variables.scss). In
addition, Horizon mostly reuses bootstrap sass variables to define the
styles.

We leverage the current idea by injecting another level of variables to
overwrite the current bootstrap/horizon variables such that developer
can swap the theme easily.

This patch includes several areas of code changes:

1. Introduce another static file subdirectory for developer to store
   custom themes.
2. Add an additional configuration in the settings.py for developer to
   load the theme to use.
3. Add an example new custom theme.
4. Refactor the current Horizon sass files such that they don't hardcode
   the style but are controlled by the variables instead.

Implements: blueprint horizon-themes

Change-Id: Id915b95b66d9aba97cdb41cc100bf7dc1d75afcd
Co-Authored-By: Alan Fung <wingfung@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kahou Lei <kahou82@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <dklyle0@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add placeholder text to transfer table search bar

This patch updates the table widget to allow for a placeholder
attribute and value to be set on the search input field. If not
specified, "Filter" is used as the default placeholder text. There is
also a SCSS mixin to style the placeholder text for various browsers,
which has been added to a new common _mixins.scss file.

Closes-Bug: 1433801

Change-Id: I4fdb57474b06ab17296d228becddf051f033556b

commit_message:
Magic Search Enablement

Make the Magic Search angular widget available in Horizon.

- Add lines to requirements.txt and static_settings.py to
bring MS in via XStatic-Magic-Search.
- Load the js files for the angular widget in _conf.html.
- Loadsthe magic_search.scss in horizon.scss
- Provide additional styling for MS in horizon.scss.

Co-Authored-By: David Kavanagh <david.kavanagh@eucalyptus.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Sahlin <asahlin@us.ibm.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint filtered-client-side-table

Depends-On: I968a874b51870bd6a39ff48daa24e53c4698007e

Change-Id: Icc8e3dd3add1c6ef615015891df2e3a425683d48

subject: Bump keystonemiddleware requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 04:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump keystonemiddleware requirement

Keystonemiddleware 1.5.0 was released 2015-03-11.

We are continuously adding new features to auth_token middleware,
however on the service side we continually check for environment
variables to discover what version of middleware is installed. Bumping
this globally should allow us to remove some older code paths and rely
on the presence of newer functionality.

Whilst not strictly required, bumping this now ensures that at least
this new version of keystone middleware will be present in kilo
distributions.

Change-Id: I45275f60e2fa1f0a372b2a1f82f43640c73f3b6f
'}]
commit_message:
Bump keystonemiddleware requirement

Keystonemiddleware 1.5.0 was released 2015-03-11.

We are continuously adding new features to auth_token middleware,
however on the service side we continually check for environment
variables to discover what version of middleware is installed. Bumping
this globally should allow us to remove some older code paths and rely
on the presence of newer functionality.

Whilst not strictly required, bumping this now ensures that at least
this new version of keystone middleware will be present in kilo
distributions.

Change-Id: I45275f60e2fa1f0a372b2a1f82f43640c73f3b6f

commit_message:
Updating defcore test definitions

Defcore now has its own repository, at
https://github.com/openstack/defcore. Updating the tempest gate script
to pull the json files from there. Also defcore is moving to a release
that does not match the branch names, so there is now a version map.

Closes-Bug: #1426442

subject: Add a python-ironicclient src job
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-12 18:37:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a python-ironicclient src job

The dsvm-tempest-neutron-src job is meant to test clients from source, however,
the devstack job it deploys does not actually deploy ironic anywhere
and thus does not actually test client changes. This closes the CI hole by
adding new tempest-dsvm-python-ironicclient-src job that runs the ironic dsvm
Tempest job with python-ironicclient from source. It is non-voting until it
proves to be functional.  Once it is, we can follow this up with another commit
to make it voting.

Change-Id: I4dca75e63fef12ebc0790b8e55bcae526c48d605
'}]
commit_message:
Add a python-ironicclient src job

The dsvm-tempest-neutron-src job is meant to test clients from source, however,
the devstack job it deploys does not actually deploy ironic anywhere
and thus does not actually test client changes. This closes the CI hole by
adding new tempest-dsvm-python-ironicclient-src job that runs the ironic dsvm
Tempest job with python-ironicclient from source. It is non-voting until it
proves to be functional.  Once it is, we can follow this up with another commit
to make it voting.

Change-Id: I4dca75e63fef12ebc0790b8e55bcae526c48d605

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-09 22:10:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Drop ironic tempest regex, stop running all of Tempest

This drops the ugly tempest regex we were using to target the subset of tests
we knew to be functional against baremetal, and instead uses the 'baremetal'
service tag to run only relevant tempest tests.

This updates the parallel and grenade jobs to do the same. Previously, these
jobs were running the entire Tempest suite against baremetal. This takes a
very long time and runs many tests that are not really relevant.

This is a shift in a previous effort to enable running the entire Tempest suite
against Ironic to running only the smallest subset of tests we care about.

Also, this enables tenant isolation where it is disabled, since that is now
functional against Ironic.

Change-Id: I1a979c644b4950f0fce59c764b115266b8a13ca8
"}]
commit_message:
Drop ironic tempest regex, stop running all of Tempest

This drops the ugly tempest regex we were using to target the subset of tests
we knew to be functional against baremetal, and instead uses the 'baremetal'
service tag to run only relevant tempest tests.

This updates the parallel and grenade jobs to do the same. Previously, these
jobs were running the entire Tempest suite against baremetal. This takes a
very long time and runs many tests that are not really relevant.

This is a shift in a previous effort to enable running the entire Tempest suite
against Ironic to running only the smallest subset of tests we care about.

Also, this enables tenant isolation where it is disabled, since that is now
functional against Ironic.

Change-Id: I1a979c644b4950f0fce59c764b115266b8a13ca8

commit_message:
Moving containers tests to separate module

This change follows on the effort to create a more hierarchical layout
for the unit tests.

Changes
* creating test_containers module
* refactoring containers tests to use the BarbicanAPIBaseTestCase base
  class
* moving WhenCreatingContainersUsingContainersResource test
* moving WhenGettingOrDeletingContainerUsingContainerResource test
* moving WhenPerformingUnallowedOperationsOnContainers test
* moving and renaming WhenGettingContainersListUsingResource test to
  WhenGettingContainersListUsingContainersResource

Change-Id: I1711f8ca69105df1b2bff8f727e2c16e1a382929

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_log, pypowervm.jobs => .tasks

Squashing these two change sets into one to work around strange gerrit
behavior that was gridlocking both.

1) Accomodate neutron change 22328baf1f60719fcaa5b0fbd91c0a3158d09c31
which removed neutron.openstack.common.log in favor of oslo_log.log.

2) pypowervm.jobs was renamed to pypowervm.tasks.  Assimilate the
change.

Change-Id: Ib22fbbc3ac5523785b04b1dd421f059b6a70de18

commit_message:
let tests be run from test file location

The tests assume that your cwd is always the project root. However, if
you are directly running testtools.run from the test file location the
samples dir can't be found. This provides compatibility for those
cases, and makes all my in buffer emacs testing much much happier.

Change-Id: I064561f4456b7505fac53a2d7944f860790e39c7

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-19 12:29:35.000000000', 'files': ['os_loganalyze/filter.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_filters.py'], 'message': "fix supports_sev matching

the regex matching for supports sev is an re.search not an re.match
because the filename provided by the wsgi request is a long path. The
previous matching strings were unique enough that this wasn't a
problem. However, once the devstack logs stopped including 'screen' in
their name these regex became dangerously generic.

n- matches gate-horizon-python27/1dba20d/console.html, for instance.

This ensures we only match at a word boundary.

Change-Id: Ifbd1361d4ddfc8ae5239e2e5290d46c00b86bf81
"}]
commit_message:
fix supports_sev matching

the regex matching for supports sev is an re.search not an re.match
because the filename provided by the wsgi request is a long path. The
previous matching strings were unique enough that this wasn't a
problem. However, once the devstack logs stopped including 'screen' in
their name these regex became dangerously generic.

n- matches gate-horizon-python27/1dba20d/console.html, for instance.

This ensures we only match at a word boundary.

Change-Id: Ifbd1361d4ddfc8ae5239e2e5290d46c00b86bf81

commit_message:
Adds compute-hyperv in StackForge

compute-hyperv is a library containing the Hyper-V Nova Driver.
Users can use this driver by setting in the Hyper-V compute node's
nova.conf:

compute_driver=hyperv.nova.driver.HyperVDriver

Supports Python 2.7 and Python 3.3.

PyPi: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/compute-hyperv
Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/compute-hyperv

Change-Id: I5792b6dbd6fb34cb53fd6b124fca6c02a3a8af2a

commit_message:

tempest-dsvm-f21 job already. And no point in keeping an experimental

commit_message:
Fix status error if deleting vm with uploading vol

If volume is uploading, we shouldn't change the status to 'available'
in process of detach volume.

Change-Id: Ie3edbac11254f130fab99867c3da0b996cfddd12
Closes-Bug: #1433415

Move genenv.sh and start.sh to tools directory

Rename them `genenv` and `start`.

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint Implement a database container set

Previously, the database container was configured for use with
Kubernetes. This patch removed any k8s dependencies, adds a script
to manage mysql server.cnf settings and splits data and app
containers. Splitting the containers provides additional
portability and operational efficiencies compared to host mounts.

Change-Id: I6dcf5abe5fd92ceb03258e64a8a86b91e3dea143

subject: WIP Fail to a different redis master when using sentinel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 16:03:44.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "WIP Fail to a different redis master when using sentinel

It's been discovered that there was no code in tooz to fail to a
different master server when using a redis setup that has one more
sentinels. To get a different master, a new client needs to be
created (by asking the sentinels for the current master).

The code in this changeset provides a proof of concept of a way of
doing this that has been demonstrated to work in manual testing. It
feels, however, to be both dirty and incomplete.

The hope is that in the process of reviewing this we can come up
with a cleaner solution.

The fundamental principle being acted upon here is that if we get a
ToozConnectionError while trying to get_members, then attempt to
_start the redis client again. This will call _make_client, querying
the sentinels for the current master.

This code only does the _start during get_members but it could be
turned on for other RedisFutureResult callers by passing a reference
to self as 'client'. There's also commented code for doing a _start
when there is a failed heartbeat.

This particular implementation is fairly closely tied to the needs
of ceilometer group membership partitioning so may not be sufficient
for general uses.

Change-Id: Icfb07deaa9290a0fcbd17844dc27acfbef52ad43
Partial-Bug: #1434043
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Fail to a different redis master when using sentinel

It's been discovered that there was no code in tooz to fail to a
different master server when using a redis setup that has one more
sentinels. To get a different master, a new client needs to be
created (by asking the sentinels for the current master).

The code in this changeset provides a proof of concept of a way of
doing this that has been demonstrated to work in manual testing. It
feels, however, to be both dirty and incomplete.

The hope is that in the process of reviewing this we can come up
with a cleaner solution.

The fundamental principle being acted upon here is that if we get a
ToozConnectionError while trying to get_members, then attempt to
_start the redis client again. This will call _make_client, querying
the sentinels for the current master.

This code only does the _start during get_members but it could be
turned on for other RedisFutureResult callers by passing a reference
to self as 'client'. There's also commented code for doing a _start
when there is a failed heartbeat.

This particular implementation is fairly closely tied to the needs
of ceilometer group membership partitioning so may not be sufficient
for general uses.

Change-Id: Icfb07deaa9290a0fcbd17844dc27acfbef52ad43
Partial-Bug: #1434043

subject: Fixes so the converge doesn't change it
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-18 21:17:30.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/nova-common_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fixes so the converge doesn't change it

@@ -14,7 +19,7 @@

-use_syslog=False
+use_syslog=false

2015-03-18 20:06:24.757 |        # Default value is False
2015-03-18 20:06:24.758 |        use_syslog=False

It was changing it to this:
2015-03-18 20:06:24.758 |        use_syslog=false

It has the same effect in the end.

Change-Id: I281e471551a3675b0fcb8fdcde70bd810b8215d4
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes so the converge doesn't change it

@@ -14,7 +19,7 @@

-use_syslog=False
+use_syslog=false

2015-03-18 20:06:24.757 |        # Default value is False
2015-03-18 20:06:24.758 |        use_syslog=False

It was changing it to this:
2015-03-18 20:06:24.758 |        use_syslog=false

It has the same effect in the end.

Change-Id: I281e471551a3675b0fcb8fdcde70bd810b8215d4

Previously services_host script was being referenced by the

unneeded in a non-k8s environment.

Fix some issues of ironic cookbook

* Change from "create_schema" to "upgrade" when dbsync
* Add some attributes
* Add identity_uri configuration item
* Add spec tests

Closes-bug: #1429245

commit_message:
Exclude security group related quotas when the extension disabled

When using neutron as network service and security group extension
disabled, the quotas update workflow will hit some error, because
'security_group' and 'security_group_rule' are passed to the quotas
update method for neutron.
This patch fixes the problem by excluding these two quotas when
neutron security group extension is disabled.

Change-Id: I0011e1c0956d3248b748f109d5ab5e93ec55f7d3
Closes-bug: 1330632
(cherry picked from commit 1246cd32e33451831255236a3abd8e5e4bf236b1)

commit_message:
Enable collector to requeue samples when enabled

If an exception is reported by the storage layer,
the dispatcher logs the error but does not
propagate it. Stevedore plugin framework also does
not propagate the exception back to the caller.

The sample is not requeued since collector does
not get the exception and returns a Handled
NotificationResult. This fix raises the exception
in the database dispatcher and enables Stevedore
to propagate exceptions to the collector.

Change-Id: I341ad92df050bf0f474b07c3f27c68cdb4f4e59b
Closes-Bug: 1433881

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9800, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-14 13:28:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Restore "Add scenario 'test_preserve_preexisting_port'"

This reverts commit 8ec99feafebd5ee67a0f4c34bcd5a30d8d42ed97

The neutron job on stable/icehouse was running more tests than what the
neutron-icehouse compat job was running against tempest changes on
master, that's why we didn't catch this when the change on master to add
the test was under review.

Note that stable/juno neutron jobs were not running these tests either
because the router extension isn't enabled.

The difference was we didn't have change
I7c80e3bfe4962c3e8c94736af21ff215cd98f7f3 on stable/icehouse or
stable/juno in devstack before the new test merged, which broke
stable/icehouse.

Now that devstack is fixed on stable and will run these scenario tests
we add a 'preserve_ports' config flag to compute-feature-enabled so it
can be toggled from devstack.
For stable branches we won't run the test since the code doesn't work in
Nova on stable (and won't be backported). For master devstack, we'll set
preserve_ports=True so the test does get run. We can remove the option
after juno-eol happens.

Devstack change: I214baa3b861e29bedf6bb7b50534ac2286676dd1

Related-Bug: #1431724

Change-Id: I95469e4c2f4aa2bc4e6342860a9c222fb4fa7e16
'}]
commit_message:
Restore "Add scenario 'test_preserve_preexisting_port'"

This reverts commit 8ec99feafebd5ee67a0f4c34bcd5a30d8d42ed97

The neutron job on stable/icehouse was running more tests than what the
neutron-icehouse compat job was running against tempest changes on
master, that's why we didn't catch this when the change on master to add
the test was under review.

Note that stable/juno neutron jobs were not running these tests either
because the router extension isn't enabled.

The difference was we didn't have change
I7c80e3bfe4962c3e8c94736af21ff215cd98f7f3 on stable/icehouse or
stable/juno in devstack before the new test merged, which broke
stable/icehouse.

Now that devstack is fixed on stable and will run these scenario tests
we add a 'preserve_ports' config flag to compute-feature-enabled so it
can be toggled from devstack.
For stable branches we won't run the test since the code doesn't work in
Nova on stable (and won't be backported). For master devstack, we'll set
preserve_ports=True so the test does get run. We can remove the option
after juno-eol happens.

Devstack change: I214baa3b861e29bedf6bb7b50534ac2286676dd1

Related-Bug: #1431724

Change-Id: I95469e4c2f4aa2bc4e6342860a9c222fb4fa7e16

commit_message:
Implement private share_types

- Add ShareTypeAccessManager to client
- Add type-access-list, type-access-add, type-access-remove
shell commands
- Add additional parameters to type-add and type-list commands
- Add appropriate unit tests

Implementation details and unit tests were mostly adapted
from Cinder and Nova access extensions.

Change-Id: Iaef80b85d413d7e7bb27ebd5cccae6bea30cb446

tempest-lib 0.4.0 was recently released which includes the auth layer,
tokens clients, and credentials objects. This contains all the pieces
for consumers of tempest lib to write there own service clients which
projects will want to start using soon. However, this is required for
tempest to remove the equivalent pieces from in tree and use the lib

Change-Id: I6ffc70364ca6e6f27e58b1ed3c371c51104307b7
'}]
commit_message:
Bump tempest-lib min version

tempest-lib 0.4.0 was recently released which includes the auth layer,
tokens clients, and credentials objects. This contains all the pieces
for consumers of tempest lib to write there own service clients which
projects will want to start using soon. However, this is required for
tempest to remove the equivalent pieces from in tree and use the lib
versions with: https://review.openstack.org/166022

Change-Id: I6ffc70364ca6e6f27e58b1ed3c371c51104307b7

artifact processing is instead being targeted by a refactored version
of project-config's run-tox.sh script.

commit_message:
Moving cdh cloudera manager password to config file

This change addresses the hard coded password for the Cloudera Manager
admin account in the CDH plugin by moving it to the configuration file.

Changes
* adding configuration option for the cdh cloudera manager password
* changing the v5 & v5_3_0 versionhandlers to use config password option
* changing the ApiResource to use config password option
* changing ClouderaUtil to use config password option

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I8e140996c08be19994cce793ae74dc8ffda2adbf
Closes-Bug: 1429989

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-20 14:44:22.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': "Change name of replication snapshot backup

The name of the backup used for replication is the same as the name of
the snapshot record.  Unfortunately, this can lead to confusion as it
could be interpreted as a backup of the replica, not for the replica.

The preposition 'of' was changed to 'for' in the replication snapshot
info name to avoid this confusion.

(Admittedly, it can make the snapshot name slightly less clear, but the
only user facing visibility of this is in the backup name.)



Change-Id: I2466b73be248c2337b2f2bb5cbcf3fc8c89d9c91"}]
commit_message:
Change name of replication snapshot backup

The name of the backup used for replication is the same as the name of
the snapshot record.  Unfortunately, this can lead to confusion as it
could be interpreted as a backup of the replica, not for the replica.

The preposition 'of' was changed to 'for' in the replication snapshot
info name to avoid this confusion.

(Admittedly, it can make the snapshot name slightly less clear, but the
only user facing visibility of this is in the backup name.)



Change-Id: I2466b73be248c2337b2f2bb5cbcf3fc8c89d9c91

subject: Add job for network based elastic-recheck queries test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-16 21:43:33.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add job for network based elastic-recheck queries test

Add non voting job to elastic-recheck to test the validity of new
queries.  (test added in I5a0b33c0e809e2ecf2050272142d1a15f60a23da) These tests are network based
(call logstash.o.o and launchpad) and are really unit tests per se, so
use 'tox -equeries' to run them instead of the standard 'tox -epy27'

Change-Id: I61cbb354e0a7864bdeadb96b45e6793ee022b6b3
"}]
commit_message:
Add job for network based elastic-recheck queries test

Add non voting job to elastic-recheck to test the validity of new
queries.  (test added in I5a0b33c0e809e2ecf2050272142d1a15f60a23da) These tests are network based
(call logstash.o.o and launchpad) and are really unit tests per se, so
use 'tox -equeries' to run them instead of the standard 'tox -epy27'

Change-Id: I61cbb354e0a7864bdeadb96b45e6793ee022b6b3

commit_message:
delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Closes-Bug: #1368661

Change-Id: Idf3a46d8c95806f2d2ce28ce84ced12b625e53df

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated oslo_concurrency and sql_connection config options

As per the logs:
 Option "lock_path" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated. Use option "lock_path" from group
"oslo_concurrency".

Option "sql_connection" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated. Use option
"connection" from group "database".

Change-Id: I2109cec07ebee916c9ce0ccd24bd9a47d8d3c688

auth plugins from the paste config file. This means that swift can now
use authentication plugins for auth_token middleware.
