subject: Keystone stop using config refs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-16 20:25:14.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': "Keystone stop using config refs

 - Rather than using config refs, deployments should be using a tool
   such as chef or puppet to set the options correctly.

 - Config refs have a bug where you can only reference an option in
   the DEFAULT group, which limits the usefulness, and with this
   feature it's impossible to move any config options out of the
   DEFAULT group, luckily this has been ignored anyways since I think
   everyone realizes how broken it is.

Change-Id: I74cae09f9d75177f8efea69e7ae981ed8f14039f
"}]
commit_message:
Keystone stop using config refs

 - Rather than using config refs, deployments should be using a tool
   such as chef or puppet to set the options correctly.

 - Config refs have a bug where you can only reference an option in
   the DEFAULT group, which limits the usefulness, and with this
   feature it's impossible to move any config options out of the
   DEFAULT group, luckily this has been ignored anyways since I think
   everyone realizes how broken it is.

Change-Id: I74cae09f9d75177f8efea69e7ae981ed8f14039f

subject: Do not break on projects without setup.cfg
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-17 20:09:42.000000000', 'files': ['update.py'], 'message': "Do not break on projects without setup.cfg

setup.cfg is used by pbr instead of setup.py.
Projects not using pbr while not have setup.cfg at all
or will have it with completely different contents.

There's already a check in update.py whether or not
the target project is using pbr, but it relies on
presence of setup.cfg, which may not be the case.

After this patch update.py will try to read setup.cfg
only after it detected that pbr is used.

Change-Id: I21fbbe159007b25db546fa6d36721e018d1dca24
"}]
commit_message:
Do not break on projects without setup.cfg

setup.cfg is used by pbr instead of setup.py.
Projects not using pbr while not have setup.cfg at all
or will have it with completely different contents.

There's already a check in update.py whether or not
the target project is using pbr, but it relies on
presence of setup.cfg, which may not be the case.

After this patch update.py will try to read setup.cfg
only after it detected that pbr is used.

Change-Id: I21fbbe159007b25db546fa6d36721e018d1dca24

subject: Remove hardware-specific proliantutils module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-20 23:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove hardware-specific proliantutils module

Remove the last hardware-specific, not-required-for-tests, python module
from global-requirements.

Ironic is now tracking these driver-specific requirements (which are
required only if an operator chooses to use that non-default hardware
driver) in a project-specific "driver-requirements.txt" file.

Change-Id: Id1a44d8ce3d250be50c972d658793c5e1256d508
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hardware-specific proliantutils module

Remove the last hardware-specific, not-required-for-tests, python module
from global-requirements.

Ironic is now tracking these driver-specific requirements (which are
required only if an operator chooses to use that non-default hardware
driver) in a project-specific "driver-requirements.txt" file.

Change-Id: Id1a44d8ce3d250be50c972d658793c5e1256d508

commit_message:
Remove flaky assert from TestMgmtInstanceDeleted test

There is a flaky assert that fails occasionally in the
mgmt.test_models.TestMgmtInstanceDeleted.test_show_deleted_mgmt_instances
unit test due to a what seems to be a race condition in the unit tests
that run in parallel. Commenting out this flaky assert to unblock gate
issues for now.

Change-Id: Ib7b5c33f49bc70427f84bd69bbcb7420b5f32d9e
Partial-bug: 1434258

subject: Add *paste.filter_factory* entry point
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-18 15:56:46.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add *paste.filter_factory* entry point

Ceilometermiddleware users don’t need to be exposed to the implementation
details of the middleware. With the entry point they can use the common
syntax to load the middleware :

  [filter:ceilometermiddleware]
  use = egg:ceilometermiddleware#swift

You can learn more about it there : http://pythonpaste.org/deploy/#introduction

Change-Id: I2574f8b3fe9f6eeb447f22a6e6a001c8d8e7cbb6
'}]
commit_message:
Add *paste.filter_factory* entry point

Ceilometermiddleware users don’t need to be exposed to the implementation
details of the middleware. With the entry point they can use the common
syntax to load the middleware :

  [filter:ceilometermiddleware]
  use = egg:ceilometermiddleware#swift

You can learn more about it there : http://pythonpaste.org/deploy/#introduction

Change-Id: I2574f8b3fe9f6eeb447f22a6e6a001c8d8e7cbb6

Partly-Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

commit_message:
Add support for external Ubuntu repositories

export MIRROR_UBUNTU='' # Ubuntu upstream repositories
export EXTRA_DEB_REPOS='' # Additional repositories,
   for example with MOS packages

export MIRROR_UBUNTU_PRIORITY=1001
export EXTRA_DEB_REPOS_PRIORITY=1050

Repositories are provided in the format like:
'deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty main'

In MIRROR_UBUNTU and EXTRA_DEB_REPOS can be provided several
repositories, separated with symbol '|'

* Also modifies /etc/fuel/astute.yaml and /etc/resolv.conf
on the Fuel master node to use the gateway of admin network
on slaves as a default gateway and nameserver after provisioning.

Change-Id: I4b7536b8a3964cc5225796eae6ac64997276024f
Partly-Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

subject: eDeploy: Store all of the facts collected by edeploy in Ironic DB
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-20 13:26:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_discoverd/plugins/edeploy.py', 'ironic_discoverd/test/test_plugins_edeploy.py'], 'message': "eDeploy: Store all of the facts collected by edeploy in Ironic DB

We want to store the benchmark data collected by the eDeploy
ramdisk. As this data is somewhat tricky to seperate out from the
facts collected by eDeploy, and the other facts may prove useful
for other cases, this patch just stores all of the collected data.
The collected facts are stored in the extra column of the Ironic
database under the 'edeploy_facts' key. This will allow us to do
manual analysis of the benchmark data before moving the node to
the available state.

Change-Id: Iadc5d1160cea4834184375adfba3bec2bf3d3d5c
"}]
commit_message:
eDeploy: Store all of the facts collected by edeploy in Ironic DB

We want to store the benchmark data collected by the eDeploy
ramdisk. As this data is somewhat tricky to seperate out from the
facts collected by eDeploy, and the other facts may prove useful
for other cases, this patch just stores all of the collected data.
The collected facts are stored in the extra column of the Ironic
database under the 'edeploy_facts' key. This will allow us to do
manual analysis of the benchmark data before moving the node to
the available state.

Change-Id: Iadc5d1160cea4834184375adfba3bec2bf3d3d5c

commit_message:
Adding security groups to existing ports

Security groups were added to port request body only during
creating port. When both port id and security groups were
provided in request for launching instance, security groups
were not updated in port.

In this change, security groups are updated even in existing
ports.

Change-Id: I660a989f7539109e5c3ea33dc835edc6c7980cd9
Closes-Bug: #1425294

subject: Change node param for ec2api rally job.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 14:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ec2-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Change node param for ec2api rally job.

Zuul expects the job to run on "devstack" workers because of the
"dsvm" in the job name (there's a zuul parameter function which
matches those up for convenience), but in this job definition I
have specified "bare" workers so that's all Jenkins registered for
it. As a result, zuul doesn't see any of the worker types it expects
registering that job name. I must correct the "node" parameter for
the gate-rally-dsvm-ec2-api-fakevirt job definition in
openstack-infra/project-config:jenkins/jobs/ec2-api.yaml then it
should work.

Change-Id: If5740498cb059e8219b2b9db4a4c565d2bc1b04e
'}]
commit_message:
Change node param for ec2api rally job.

Zuul expects the job to run on "devstack" workers because of the
"dsvm" in the job name (there's a zuul parameter function which
matches those up for convenience), but in this job definition I
have specified "bare" workers so that's all Jenkins registered for
it. As a result, zuul doesn't see any of the worker types it expects
registering that job name. I must correct the "node" parameter for
the gate-rally-dsvm-ec2-api-fakevirt job definition in
openstack-infra/project-config:jenkins/jobs/ec2-api.yaml then it
should work.

Change-Id: If5740498cb059e8219b2b9db4a4c565d2bc1b04e

commit_message:
Add experimental job for Manila scenario tests

The scenario tests will use plenty of time and it makes
sense to separate them from the api/cli tests. We also
need to stabilize the tests. Therefore their are experimental
as a first step.

$JOB_NAME can be used to select only the scenario tests in
post_test_hook (manila code).

Change-Id: Ia0326748e6140f1089328dbb94f2f56900b85318

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 20:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml'], 'message': 'Custom OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES for heat-dsvm-functional

The heat functional tests job currently runs with the default
services including unused services such as ceilometer, horizon,
sahara, fwaas, lbaas, and trove.

This change uses OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES to build a targetted
list of services required to run the tests.

When integration tests are added which require any of these
removed services the services can be enabled.

A targetted list of services should result in quicker test times
and preservation of CI resources.

The enabled services does not include dib, since this has just
been removed from devstack.

Change-Id: Ieaa59c61f7de1369fb227a1709058ef8638c9561
'}]
commit_message:
Custom OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES for heat-dsvm-functional

The heat functional tests job currently runs with the default
services including unused services such as ceilometer, horizon,
sahara, fwaas, lbaas, and trove.

This change uses OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES to build a targetted
list of services required to run the tests.

When integration tests are added which require any of these
removed services the services can be enabled.

A targetted list of services should result in quicker test times
and preservation of CI resources.

The enabled services does not include dib, since this has just
been removed from devstack.

Change-Id: Ieaa59c61f7de1369fb227a1709058ef8638c9561

commit_message:
support specify user-id when create sample and alarm

The change of I9ba984f804aecee5b63e5a86e699733040dee245 enables
us to specify os-user-id in CLI, but it shadows the user-id when
creating sample and alarm, this patch fixes it as what we've done
for project-id.

commit_message:
Add support for 'gateway' option provided in settings

The 'gateway' field is used by NetworkManager.get_default_gateway()
in the Nailgun. For 'fuelweb_admin' network it was empty, so
settings.MASTER_IP was used as default gateway.

Now, default gateway for 'fuelweb_admin' network can be configured
in the /etc/fuel/astute.yaml, option dhcp_gateway; so this setting
should be used as default gateway for provisioning.

Depends on: I3757f6751f649595ed793bc9804904ef03b55d53
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

Change-Id: I36d718c62f40d36dd3260038d087d630d45e5f34

commit_message:
Up pymongo version to avoid memory leak

Pymongo 2.6 and 2.6.2 have memory and lock leaks respectively.
this patch brings the version to >=2.6.3 to avoid installing
pymongo clients with leaks.

see: http://api.mongodb.org/python/current/changelog.html

Closes-bug: #1372835
Change-Id: Idaa11fa02b4b39f330aa88670228a70880db3865

subject: Import cap.py tool to cap  explicit dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-20 23:32:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cap.py'], 'message': "Import cap.py tool to cap  explicit dependencies

This is a forward port of the tool we used to cap stable/juno
requirements. Save a copy of it in master so its available when we are
ready to cut future stable branches.

pin all global-requirements with the version found in pip-freeze
along with a tool to generate the new requirements file

Issues:
* Some versions are only apt-get installable (suds 0.4.1)
* Not all packages are installed in our standard dsvm-tempest env
* Some versions are lower then the minimum requirement we previously had
  because python is awful (libvirt-python)
* Doesn't pin transitive dependencies
* library versions can vanish from pypi and still break us
* Grenade and tempest-full pip-freezes are different and do not work with
each other, so some tweaking is required.

Taking the installed library version from pip-freeze and use that as a
version cap.

Previously used pip-freeze from a tempest-dsvm-neutron-full job.

Change-Id: Iaf48bb069fdd7a19d614ce44b86abd9977c5f0c0
"}]
commit_message:
Import cap.py tool to cap  explicit dependencies

This is a forward port of the tool we used to cap stable/juno
requirements. Save a copy of it in master so its available when we are
ready to cut future stable branches.

pin all global-requirements with the version found in pip-freeze
along with a tool to generate the new requirements file

Issues:
* Some versions are only apt-get installable (suds 0.4.1)
* Not all packages are installed in our standard dsvm-tempest env
* Some versions are lower then the minimum requirement we previously had
  because python is awful (libvirt-python)
* Doesn't pin transitive dependencies
* library versions can vanish from pypi and still break us
* Grenade and tempest-full pip-freezes are different and do not work with
each other, so some tweaking is required.

Taking the installed library version from pip-freeze and use that as a
version cap.

Previously used pip-freeze from a tempest-dsvm-neutron-full job.

Change-Id: Iaf48bb069fdd7a19d614ce44b86abd9977c5f0c0

commit_message:
Do not add @domain_name to dnsmasq.conf if it equals 'local'

Currently dnsmasq tries to resolve locally a host named
test.mydomain.local instead of forwarding this request to the local dns
server.

Change-Id: I5892fddaffa0dc619f0a54ac0f9fac34055b9b3f
Closes-Bug: 1411425

commit_message:
Raise the default max header to accommodate large tokens

PKI tokens hit the default limit if there is enough
services defined in the keystone catalog.

So sahara should allow users to customize max header size and
also increase the default value from 8192 to 16384.

Change-Id: If3daff1ba18f7fcd4cf3b7d9b4152b551d8ad277
Closes-Bug: 1190149

* specify net.ifnames=0 to disable Predictable NIC names for cobbler
  Ubuntu profiles
* specify net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 in nailgun in order to change NIC
  scheme during preseed provisioning

commit_message:
Disable predictable NIC names

* specify net.ifnames=0 to disable Predictable NIC names for cobbler
  Ubuntu profiles
* specify net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 in nailgun in order to change NIC
  scheme during preseed provisioning
* Copy /target/etc/network/interfaces to /etc/network/interfaces as
  finish-install.d/55netcfg-copy-config from netcfg always copies it back to
  /target

Change-Id: Ice24badd3ccc50c4b10230601cbf06788376c86c
Closes-Bug: 1430271
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 17:57:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'message': "Add no_timer_check to vm grub cmdline

no_timer_check prevents the kernel from probing for hardware timers,
which doesn't make sense in a virtual environment and can cause
hangs at boot [1] [2].

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1082030
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1102592

"}]
commit_message:
Add no_timer_check to vm grub cmdline

no_timer_check prevents the kernel from probing for hardware timers,
which doesn't make sense in a virtual environment and can cause
hangs at boot [1] [2].

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1082030
[2]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1102592

Change-Id: I1c42cc7fae7bba1dc6f4feb69f13760f4312e4d1

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-19 18:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': "Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create

Currently, the 3PAR drivers rely on the pool (CPG) existing
in the extra specs of a volume type.   This is the way that the
3PAR drivers supported the idea of 'pools' prior to Cinder
itself supporting pools.

Now, the 3PAR drivers will not use the CPG specified in the
extra specs of a volume type.   The drivers will log a warning
explaining that CPG is deprecated, and then override the CPG
setting with the pool name specified by the scheduler in the
volume['host'] entry.    This fixes a few bugs in the 3PAR
drivers.

Existing 3PAR deployments will need to update their cinder.conf
to specify the list of CPGs they want the driver to support as
pools in the hp3par_cpg=[list of cpgs] entry.  hp3par_cpg can be
a single CPG, or a comma separated list of CPGS.

The 3PAR best practice guide will be updated for the Kilo release
explaining how to upgrade from existing deployments and describe
how best to use CPGS as pools.

Closes-Bug: #1432876
DocImpact

Change-Id: I2c733ff3f13ba309cc07e07331b4945b1981a07a
"}]
commit_message:
Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create

Currently, the 3PAR drivers rely on the pool (CPG) existing
in the extra specs of a volume type.   This is the way that the
3PAR drivers supported the idea of 'pools' prior to Cinder
itself supporting pools.

Now, the 3PAR drivers will not use the CPG specified in the
extra specs of a volume type.   The drivers will log a warning
explaining that CPG is deprecated, and then override the CPG
setting with the pool name specified by the scheduler in the
volume['host'] entry.    This fixes a few bugs in the 3PAR
drivers.

Existing 3PAR deployments will need to update their cinder.conf
to specify the list of CPGs they want the driver to support as
pools in the hp3par_cpg=[list of cpgs] entry.  hp3par_cpg can be
a single CPG, or a comma separated list of CPGS.

The 3PAR best practice guide will be updated for the Kilo release
explaining how to upgrade from existing deployments and describe
how best to use CPGS as pools.

Closes-Bug: #1432876
DocImpact

Change-Id: I2c733ff3f13ba309cc07e07331b4945b1981a07a

commit_message:
Change way to check memcached

Current implementation of memcached and RabbitMQ monitoring in Zabbix
is wrong. It doesn't work if we trying to check stats not from separate
script. So, that script was created.

Change-Id: I2cc11c39c91f485164872c8c8b11ef9d61ce9ae0
Closes-Bug: 1394252

commit_message:
fix manifests for cinder-vmware role

1. Fix dependency graph for granular deployment.
2. Simplification of the code and removing useless things.
3. Correct working with multiple vCenter. Not needed yet
(in Fuel 6.1), but will be better do it right from the start.
4. Add copyright's info.

Change-Id: I194d2ee7a9d9908703297f836104860f81cef495
Implements: blueprint cinder-vmdk-role
Closes-bug: 1433201

subject: Fix a typo in api_microversions spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 11:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.rst'], 'message': 'Fix a typo in api_microversions spec

There is a sentence described:
If a request for version 2.11 is made by a client, the client will
receive a 404 as if the method does not exist at all.

but either from code and the descriptions above shows it will return
406 (HTTPNotAcceptable). This is a typo but may lead confusion
to readers so worthy to change it.

Change-Id: Ibcc031e35de54d5f16abc3ce3abac9a282e8b2fe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a typo in api_microversions spec

There is a sentence described:
If a request for version 2.11 is made by a client, the client will
receive a 404 as if the method does not exist at all.

but either from code and the descriptions above shows it will return
406 (HTTPNotAcceptable). This is a typo but may lead confusion
to readers so worthy to change it.

Change-Id: Ibcc031e35de54d5f16abc3ce3abac9a282e8b2fe

commit_message:
Initial multi-VIOS enablement

This is the first change set which gathers a set of Virtual I/O Server
elements.  None of the connection algorithms have been updated to make
use of multiple VIOSes yet.

This change set removes the vios_name from the conf options.  As most
operations will work against multiple VIOSes, and other conf options
will identify the VIOSes.

The new code generates a map of VIOS names to UUIDs.  It does not wrap
the whole objects because those become stale.

Change-Id: Id3c02d0f953181922f34a2758e41d11d141e5877

commit_message:
Bump novaclient version

Novaclient 2.22.0 was released 2015-03-02 after a long break (ignoring
the failed 2.21). Updating this would allow me to remove some hacks
around its use in other projects.

commit_message:
Don't override extra specs with config in VMAX

A recent merge in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157679
brought in regression because it tied volume type extra specs to
config file settings.

This patch rolled back most of the changes and don't let extra specs
be overwritten by the config file settings. Intervals and retries
will be read from the config file.

Partial-Bug: #1425641
Change-Id: I7b7959d64f9cc5e954d03f56f6a37021c4c0e9e1

commit_message:
Removing HP MSA driver for no reported CI

CI deadlines were set and pushed since last year. An email about this
requirement and the deadline of March 19th 2015 has been sent to each
individual driver maintainer, as well as the mailing list [1]. This
driver is being removed because it's not supported, so it won't have
a CI reporting to ensure their driver integration is successful.
Therfore, we can not validate the driver is working in Cinder today in
a continuous way.

DocImpact
[1]- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/054614.html

Change-Id: Ia6681e943ffb807ff6b3064976f6ef8eb3259e65

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7485, 'name': 'Tushar Gohad', 'email': 'tushar.gohad@intel.com', 'username': 'tsg'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-16 14:54:50.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Diskfile decides if durable is written based on policy

- Move the object server PUT path call to write_durable_timestamp()
outside of multi-phase commit conditional scope so that it is always
called at end of PUT. Otherwise multipart commit will need to be
implemented in ssync just to get a durable file created after ssync'ing
a fragment archive.

- Make DiskFileWriter.write_durable_timestamp() decide whether
a durable file should be created or not based on policy. This also
better encapuslates diskfile implementation.

- move the durable file creation to run in a separate thread

- add an fsync of the durable file

- add a call to hash_cleanup_listdir after the durable file has been
written - the existing call after the data file has been renamed is
ineffective with EC policy

- catch IOErrors and OSError in write_durable_timestamp and raise
DiskFileErrors

- Added unit tests to verify changes and to verify that a durable
file is not created for a replication policy and is created for a
EC policy.

Change-Id: Icd4ac620b115b15a0d5cd8f785952ad401f1ac4a
"}]
commit_message:
Diskfile decides if durable is written based on policy

- Move the object server PUT path call to write_durable_timestamp()
outside of multi-phase commit conditional scope so that it is always
called at end of PUT. Otherwise multipart commit will need to be
implemented in ssync just to get a durable file created after ssync'ing
a fragment archive.

- Make DiskFileWriter.write_durable_timestamp() decide whether
a durable file should be created or not based on policy. This also
better encapuslates diskfile implementation.

- move the durable file creation to run in a separate thread

- add an fsync of the durable file

- add a call to hash_cleanup_listdir after the durable file has been
written - the existing call after the data file has been renamed is
ineffective with EC policy

- catch IOErrors and OSError in write_durable_timestamp and raise
DiskFileErrors

- Added unit tests to verify changes and to verify that a durable
file is not created for a replication policy and is created for a
EC policy.

Change-Id: Icd4ac620b115b15a0d5cd8f785952ad401f1ac4a

subject: Fix a lack of method arguments at tempauth
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-20 09:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py'], 'message': "Fix a lack of method arguments at tempauth

This fixes a kind of trivial issue with TypeError caused by a lack
of method argument at calling.

When using 'Authorization' header with tempauth, tempauth calls
_get_user_groups with 3 arguments (includes self) on current code
but the method requires 4 arguments so it will go to fail with 500.

This patch fixes to take correct arguments and adds an unit test
for the case.

Closes-Bug:1434465

Change-Id: Ibf00c41fa8e5cfdaf49bc4d571e575d7f229ebfe
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a lack of method arguments at tempauth

This fixes a kind of trivial issue with TypeError caused by a lack
of method argument at calling.

When using 'Authorization' header with tempauth, tempauth calls
_get_user_groups with 3 arguments (includes self) on current code
but the method requires 4 arguments so it will go to fail with 500.

This patch fixes to take correct arguments and adds an unit test
for the case.

Closes-Bug:1434465

Change-Id: Ibf00c41fa8e5cfdaf49bc4d571e575d7f229ebfe

commit_message:
Adding hiredis as a dependancy

Hiredis helps perform faster parsing of redis commands
and output aiding performance

The dependancy will be used for adding redis as a oslo config
cache backend as well as in marconi as a storage backend

The software is distributed under a BSD license

Change-Id: Ic835cef545cc1d27100b62204a4a48607b8c2709

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-19 17:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/coraid.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py'], 'message': 'Removing Coraid driver for no reported CI

CI deadlines were set and pushed since last year. An email about this
requirement and the deadline of March 19th 2015 has been sent to each
individual driver maintainer, as well as the mailing list [1]. This
driver is being removed because the maintainer has chosen not to respond
to the CI deadline email and report a CI to ensure their driver
integration is successful. Therfore, we can not validate the driver is
working in Cinder today in a continuous way.

DocImpact
[1] - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/054614.html

Change-Id: I033960c21db91c3150daeffa3dae38005b7ef39b
'}]
commit_message:
Removing Coraid driver for no reported CI

CI deadlines were set and pushed since last year. An email about this
requirement and the deadline of March 19th 2015 has been sent to each
individual driver maintainer, as well as the mailing list [1]. This
driver is being removed because the maintainer has chosen not to respond
to the CI deadline email and report a CI to ensure their driver
integration is successful. Therfore, we can not validate the driver is
working in Cinder today in a continuous way.

DocImpact
[1] - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/054614.html

Change-Id: I033960c21db91c3150daeffa3dae38005b7ef39b

commit_message:
Remove wait_for function

Glance and any of the other containers will not need to use
the wait_for function if you add the flag --restart=always.
This ensures that the containers restart upon failure fixing
the issue caused by the race condition.

Closes-Bug: #1432332

Change-Id: Ida7831a69c8dccbe8b36a3007140747d9eaf1468

commit_message:
Use OrderedDict as data structure for networkx graph

OrderedDict will preserve order in which tasks are inserted
and given that fact that json array is structured, and
tasks found always in same order from directory -
we will guarantee that order of execution will not be changed,
even for tasks with same requirements

Change-Id: I5bc60b9754bb6a8e0d1318848d810603ec7b201e
Closes-Bug: 1434132

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-17 12:17:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/wsgi/django.wsgi'], 'message': "Update WSGI app creation to be compatible with Django 1.7

This resolves the following error when trying to run Horizon:

AppRegistryNotReady: The translation infrastructure cannot be
initialized before the apps registry is ready. Check that you don't
make non-lazy gettext calls at import time.

and is backwards-compatible with our currently supported versions (back
to 1.4).

Change-Id: I1e59f2bf6633a34cfe9230aa028f345e5fa70f94
Closes-Bug: #1382023
(cherry picked from commit 686af384c201148c3aebcfbf18b2527587d70ea4)
"}]
commit_message:
Update WSGI app creation to be compatible with Django 1.7

This resolves the following error when trying to run Horizon:

AppRegistryNotReady: The translation infrastructure cannot be
initialized before the apps registry is ready. Check that you don't
make non-lazy gettext calls at import time.

and is backwards-compatible with our currently supported versions (back
to 1.4).

Change-Id: I1e59f2bf6633a34cfe9230aa028f345e5fa70f94
Closes-Bug: #1382023
(cherry picked from commit 686af384c201148c3aebcfbf18b2527587d70ea4)

commit_message:
Deal with syslinux version 6

Dependencies have changed such that syslinux-common is no longer
installed by default.  It contains necessary files for pxe booting, so
we need to install it.

The pxelinux.0 also now has dependencies on modules that need to be
copied in.

And of course different distros are packaged differently.

Closes-Bug: #1351010
Change-Id: I721fbf422bfb2742fd986e8878df3b9bcf416c15

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-24 16:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_functions.sh', 'scripts/extract-docs', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Enable Parallelising of image builds

Provide a flag which will enable parallel builds, only when the
--build-only flag is also set.

When running devtest.sh, run all of the image builds in parallel
by forking all of the devtest_* scripts.  Then wait for all of the
builds to provide an accurate return status.

Similarly, for devtest_overcloud.sh, which builds multiple images,

'}]
commit_message:
Enable Parallelising of image builds

Provide a flag which will enable parallel builds, only when the
--build-only flag is also set.

When running devtest.sh, run all of the image builds in parallel
by forking all of the devtest_* scripts.  Then wait for all of the
builds to provide an accurate return status.

Similarly, for devtest_overcloud.sh, which builds multiple images,
fork each image build and wait before returning.

This showed improvement from ~1700 seconds to ~470 seconds build time.

Change-Id: I0a9acd274dfe7b983196e600c3beea7b298ff775

revisions:

The undercloud requires some additional configuration in order to run
Icinga: to wit, it needs to be able to locate the overcloud services in
order to pull in the list of servers it should expect checks to
arrive from.

This change adds the structured configuration and deployment for
Icinga on the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ia0f73b05254a6535558b7933bff0cf0129ae6fcf
'}]
commit_message:
Add structured configuration for Icinga

The undercloud requires some additional configuration in order to run
Icinga: to wit, it needs to be able to locate the overcloud services in
order to pull in the list of servers it should expect checks to
arrive from.

This change adds the structured configuration and deployment for
Icinga on the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ia0f73b05254a6535558b7933bff0cf0129ae6fcf

subject: Create reusable image definitions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-06 14:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/tripleo-reusable-image-definition.rst'], 'message': 'Create reusable image definitions

The tripleo-incubator scripts currently define the images required,
how to build those images, and also how to deploy those images.

These image definitions should be reusable and extensible outside of
the tripleo-incubator scripts to allow for the creation of user
tooling to build the images that can then be reused within
tripleo-incubator, tuskar, and any other places where image building
is necessary.

Change-Id: Icc99d8c396741b8cfa5e74e300dbe2e803bb9a72
'}]
commit_message:
Create reusable image definitions

The tripleo-incubator scripts currently define the images required,
how to build those images, and also how to deploy those images.

These image definitions should be reusable and extensible outside of
the tripleo-incubator scripts to allow for the creation of user
tooling to build the images that can then be reused within
tripleo-incubator, tuskar, and any other places where image building
is necessary.

Change-Id: Icc99d8c396741b8cfa5e74e300dbe2e803bb9a72

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 215, 'name': 'Jon-Paul Sullivan', 'email': 'j3p0uk@hotmail.com', 'username': 'jonpaul-sullivan'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5639, 'name': 'Coleman Corrigan', 'email': 'coleman.corrigan@hp.com', 'username': 'coleman-corrigan'}, {'_account_id': 6153, 'name': 'stephen-mulcahy', 'email': 'stephen.mulcahy@hpe.com', 'username': 'stephen-mulcahy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7579, 'name': 'jan grant', 'email': 'jan.grant@hpe.com', 'username': 'jang'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-13 16:50:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_variables.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Enable selective dib configuration per image

Enable a mechanism by which dib variables can be passed selectively
into an image from the environment during a full devtest.sh run.

DIB elements often take arguments in the form of environment variables,
and there is no way to differentiate which image a variable in the user
environment should apply to when running devtest, as the same variable
would be used in each execution of diskimage-builder during the run.

This change runs diskimage-builder in a sub-shell after setting the
element variables from image-specific prefixes, thus allowing the user
to specify DIB variables on a per-image basis.

These variables prefixes are:
    * SEED_DIB_VAR_
    * UNDERCLOUD_DIB_VAR_
    * OVERCLOUD_CONTROL_DIB_VAR_
    * OVERCLOUD_COMPUTE_DIB_VAR_
    * USER_DIB_VAR_

So to pass DIB_NO_PYPI_PIP=1 to only the undercloud for example,
prior to running devtest.sh you would:
    export UNDERCLOUD_DIB_VAR_DIB_NO_PYPI_PIP=1

Change-Id: I42745756bbf2f5b2a79836dea61dca3a6061cc50
'}]
commit_message:
Enable selective dib configuration per image

Enable a mechanism by which dib variables can be passed selectively
into an image from the environment during a full devtest.sh run.

DIB elements often take arguments in the form of environment variables,
and there is no way to differentiate which image a variable in the user
environment should apply to when running devtest, as the same variable
would be used in each execution of diskimage-builder during the run.

This change runs diskimage-builder in a sub-shell after setting the
element variables from image-specific prefixes, thus allowing the user
to specify DIB variables on a per-image basis.

These variables prefixes are:
    * SEED_DIB_VAR_
    * UNDERCLOUD_DIB_VAR_
    * OVERCLOUD_CONTROL_DIB_VAR_
    * OVERCLOUD_COMPUTE_DIB_VAR_
    * USER_DIB_VAR_

So to pass DIB_NO_PYPI_PIP=1 to only the undercloud for example,
prior to running devtest.sh you would:
    export UNDERCLOUD_DIB_VAR_DIB_NO_PYPI_PIP=1

Change-Id: I42745756bbf2f5b2a79836dea61dca3a6061cc50

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-19 21:52:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_dhcp_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Make DHCP tests cleanup neutron manager reference

The DHCP scheduler unit tests occasionally call methods
on the core plugin via the neutron manager (e.g. in report_state).
However, they weren't calling the normal unit test cleanup routines
for tests that call the core plugin so they were leaving stale
references in the manager.

This patch uses the setup_coreplugin helper that sets up the
configuration for the core plugin and adds the cleanup call
to ensure that the neutron manager is cleaned up at the end
of each test.

Closes-Bug: #1434278
Change-Id: Ic35629659574121c739574c1ed39364d6977c3ea
"}]
commit_message:
Make DHCP tests cleanup neutron manager reference

The DHCP scheduler unit tests occasionally call methods
on the core plugin via the neutron manager (e.g. in report_state).
However, they weren't calling the normal unit test cleanup routines
for tests that call the core plugin so they were leaving stale
references in the manager.

This patch uses the setup_coreplugin helper that sets up the
configuration for the core plugin and adds the cleanup call
to ensure that the neutron manager is cleaned up at the end
of each test.

Closes-Bug: #1434278
Change-Id: Ic35629659574121c739574c1ed39364d6977c3ea

commit_message:
Add the Ceph ready checking

When we deploy environment with big number of Ceph OSDs it takes time
to get ceph ready to use.

Docimpact: operations documentation http://ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/monitoring/
Closes-bug: #1415954
Change-Id: If7ae4948978047e1dd533e300eb1bfdc61b51035

commit_message:
Fix log import error in tempest tests for Sahara

Fix log import error in base class of client tests.
Tempest now use olso.log for logging,
instead of log module from tempest common or tempest-lib.

Closes-bug: #1425835

Change-Id: Idb1ea80af5f567e198380171b0c9216952b85b50

commit_message:
Add 'image' resource support

'Image' resource support is added to resources
with the following attributes:
- name
- container_format
- disk_format

Supported metrics:
- image
- image.size

Tests added to test_rest.py

Change-Id: I14bfbffd686299c5141a49d34cfa191e2dd99f0c

subject: Fix packages not getting installed if service name in base path
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-19 23:40:52.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Fix packages not getting installed if service name in base path

Currently, if devstack base path includes the name of a given
service (e.g. nova), then the service's prereq packages will
not be installed. This fix changes the checking the match
against the full path of the package list file rather than the
name of a given service.

Closes-Bug: #1434314
Change-Id: Ie81352ebd5691afc6d0019f71d5b62370e8bb95f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix packages not getting installed if service name in base path

Currently, if devstack base path includes the name of a given
service (e.g. nova), then the service's prereq packages will
not be installed. This fix changes the checking the match
against the full path of the package list file rather than the
name of a given service.

Closes-Bug: #1434314
Change-Id: Ie81352ebd5691afc6d0019f71d5b62370e8bb95f

commit_message:
Populates retry info when unshelve offloaded instance

This patch populates retry info into filter_properties when unshelve
offloaded instance. This is used to support rescheduling for unshelve
instance.

subject: Update puppet-setproxy to belong to Gozer group
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-17 16:20:05.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/stackforge/gozer.config', 'gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Update puppet-setproxy to belong to Gozer group

Puppet-openstack is intended to be a place for reviewing
puppet modules to deploy OpenStack, and that's not the
case. It's a generic module to be set proxy services,
more related with downstream Infra usage.
Moving ownership to Gozer team to grant control of it.

Change-Id: I281ee9686f9ae874bf35989a52c6fc692c8a9e9b
"}]
commit_message:
Update puppet-setproxy to belong to Gozer group

Puppet-openstack is intended to be a place for reviewing
puppet modules to deploy OpenStack, and that's not the
case. It's a generic module to be set proxy services,
more related with downstream Infra usage.
Moving ownership to Gozer team to grant control of it.

Change-Id: I281ee9686f9ae874bf35989a52c6fc692c8a9e9b

It has been mentioned a number of times that the self.requests naming
for the requests_mock object is confusing between whether you are
actually sending a request or are mocking a request.

Rename all entries of the requests object to requests_mock.

This cleans up a couple of entries where the older register_uri format
was being used in favour of using the HTTP method as the requests_mock
method.

Change-Id: I315085b4088130b510f9dbd696011d983598372c

commit_message:
Rename requests mock object in testing

It has been mentioned a number of times that the self.requests naming
for the requests_mock object is confusing between whether you are
actually sending a request or are mocking a request.

Rename all entries of the requests object to requests_mock.

This cleans up a couple of entries where the older register_uri format
was being used in favour of using the HTTP method as the requests_mock
method.

Change-Id: I315085b4088130b510f9dbd696011d983598372c

subject: Refactors Keystone Start Script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-20 05:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/start.sh'], 'message': 'Refactors Keystone Start Script

1. The openrc was using admin instead of KEYSTONE_USER and public
port instead of admin port.

2. Keystone was being killed and restarted after creating user,
tenant, service, endpoint, etc.. Keystone does not need to be
stopped and restarted.

3. Prefixed SERVICE_TOKEN/SERVICE_ENDPOINT with OS_ per
OpenStack documentation.

Change-Id: If05b90480e1e8bf7f0154a4407a49ddb510f4380
'}]
commit_message:
Refactors Keystone Start Script

1. The openrc was using admin instead of KEYSTONE_USER and public
port instead of admin port.

2. Keystone was being killed and restarted after creating user,
tenant, service, endpoint, etc.. Keystone does not need to be
stopped and restarted.

3. Prefixed SERVICE_TOKEN/SERVICE_ENDPOINT with OS_ per
OpenStack documentation.

Change-Id: If05b90480e1e8bf7f0154a4407a49ddb510f4380

commit_message:
Trigger remaining-executions and first-exec-date

Adds the support of two optionals parameters for the cron-trigger resource:
  -first-execution-time : --first-time <"YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM">
  -remaining_occurrences : --count <integer>

The positional parameter "pattern" is now: --pattern <"* * * * *">

Implements: blueprint mistral-cron-triggers-start-and-repeat
Depends-On: I55bc28e98f89ffdfdce9cb3daa3848a17d85fd20
Change-Id: I2059db83e217ff415fb3f43dca27904b8f9acdce

commit_message:
VMware: use instance UUID as instance name

The patch set remove the instance_name parameter that was passed
to spawn and other methods. This parameter was used for the naming
of the rescue and resize VM's. The fact that those are now done on
the original instance enables us to drop this 'instance_name'
parameter.

This simplifies the code and unit tests.

Change-Id: I7262d0b69fc08144b5675cfeafb5a40668a472d0

commit_message:
Make sahara permission check backward compatible

In kilo, the service type of sahara changed from data_processing
to data-processing.

We should be checking for both data-processing and data_processing
service for backward compatability.

Change-Id: I6f55938b7c9dedcacc2fd6ba27c14ecc4e8565e3
Closes-Bug: #1433816

commit_message:
Call notify_usage_exists() without conductor proxying

A previous change converted a final direct db call in notifications
to use objects so that calls to notify_usage_exists() now can be made
directly instead of proxying through conductor.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

subject: Call db refresh in Stack object refresh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 22:42:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/stack.py'], 'message': "Call db refresh in Stack object refresh

The current Stack object refresh doesn't actually do any refreshing,
which explains the functional test speed regression since the RPC
nested stack code relies on stack.refresh() to poll for state change.

With this change AutoScalingSignalTest.test_signal_with_policy_update
locally takes ~60s consistently. Without this change ~50% of test runs
have some form of execution delay, taking 80s -> 300s+.

Change-Id: Ie06851fd5b0d8b802ebf701e8bf621562d9b6d88
Closes-Bug: #1433555
"}]
commit_message:
Call db refresh in Stack object refresh

The current Stack object refresh doesn't actually do any refreshing,
which explains the functional test speed regression since the RPC
nested stack code relies on stack.refresh() to poll for state change.

With this change AutoScalingSignalTest.test_signal_with_policy_update
locally takes ~60s consistently. Without this change ~50% of test runs
have some form of execution delay, taking 80s -> 300s+.

Change-Id: Ie06851fd5b0d8b802ebf701e8bf621562d9b6d88
Closes-Bug: #1433555

modal dialog.

Change-Id: I6d089ec4be7df1a87310321ba950fb365965cf4d
"}]
commit_message:
Demo for focus-trap

After loading Horizon UI, you will see a blue button
on the top-left corner of the screen, a wizard can be
opened by clicking on the button. When navigating focus
via keyboard (tab/shift + tag), the focus will be either
on focuable elements in the popup dialog or on browser's
native control, but never on html element outside the
modal dialog.

Change-Id: I6d089ec4be7df1a87310321ba950fb365965cf4d

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-17 05:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/stack-lifecycle-scheduler-hint.rst'], 'message': 'Spec for stack lifecycle scheduler hint

A custom scheduler needs a way to map a nova request back to any
holistic scheduling decisions made through plugins using
the stack lifecycle plug point. This spec describes a
mechanism whereby the stack id, root stack id,
stack resource id, stack resource name and the path in the
stack (as a list of tuples, (stackresourcename, stackname))
can be passed to nova by heat as scheduler hints, to the

Co-Authored-By: Karolyn Chambers <chamberk@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Spec for stack lifecycle scheduler hint

A custom scheduler needs a way to map a nova request back to any
holistic scheduling decisions made through plugins using
the stack lifecycle plug point. This spec describes a
mechanism whereby the stack id, root stack id,
stack resource id, stack resource name and the path in the
stack (as a list of tuples, (stackresourcename, stackname))
can be passed to nova by heat as scheduler hints, to the
configured schedulers for nova.

Change-Id: Ia8ecdee9419106994381fc24bc7df176ed5aafab
Specifies: bp stack-lifecycle-scheduler-hint
Co-Authored-By: Karolyn Chambers <chamberk@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Change datetime.now() to timeutils.utcnow() from oslo_utils

We use an UTC time to avoid the difference with time zones.

Change-Id: I15aa3b5d3337b90ccdcc6c4ac5d3c7d78108fe21
Related-Bug: #1288979

commit_message:
Add deprecation warning to logs.

When generating a DeprecatedOpt instance, an informational log message will
be generated. This is done so that users are given notice of deprecated
options, regardless of whether or not an accompanying new option was
used.

Change-Id: Ifc83d5f6ec6a17583de3c0c674a0b3fb70f97504
Closes-Bug: #1390408

commit_message:

config.py: Add default configurations for the location
    of the cluster rpc service.

    the cluster.

Fixes MNP-65

commit_message:
Make public shares visible for all tenants

Add new param '--public' to 'manila list' which would allow user
to list public shares from all projects along with shares for current project.

Rename 'manila rename' to 'manila update'. Add '--public' param to 'manila create'
and 'manila update'.

Add unit tests.

Implements bp level-of-visibility-for-shares

Change-Id: I69aafa32754f037f573b73e79d9cb6a6084d165e

subject: Print share export locations more pretty
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-19 17:08:40.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Print share export locations more pretty

Manila provides two fields with export locations:
- 'export_location' (deprecated)
- 'export_locations' (introduced in Kilo-3)

So, remove the former from output if the latter exist and transform the latter
to text from list with 'newline' separators. It will make output more pretty:

+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| Property          | Value                                      |
+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| status            | available                                  |
| export_locations  | 1.2.3.4:/f/o/o                             |
|                   | 5.6.7.8:/b/a/r                             |
|                   | 9.10.11.12:/q/u/u/z                        |
| id                | d778d2ee-b6bb-4c5f-9f5d-6f3057d549b1       |
| size              | 1                                          |
| share_proto       | NFS                                        |
+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+

Change-Id: Ic1e5ae194821afa0680f3c53b5000d7e22bbfa00
"}]
commit_message:
Print share export locations more pretty

Manila provides two fields with export locations:
- 'export_location' (deprecated)
- 'export_locations' (introduced in Kilo-3)

So, remove the former from output if the latter exist and transform the latter
to text from list with 'newline' separators. It will make output more pretty:

+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| Property          | Value                                      |
+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+
| status            | available                                  |
| export_locations  | 1.2.3.4:/f/o/o                             |
|                   | 5.6.7.8:/b/a/r                             |
|                   | 9.10.11.12:/q/u/u/z                        |
| id                | d778d2ee-b6bb-4c5f-9f5d-6f3057d549b1       |
| size              | 1                                          |
| share_proto       | NFS                                        |
+-------------------+--------------------------------------------+

Change-Id: Ic1e5ae194821afa0680f3c53b5000d7e22bbfa00

subject: Rename requests mock object in testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 03:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/test_s3_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth.py'], 'message': 'Rename requests mock object in testing

It has been mentioned a number of times that the self.requests naming
for the requests_mock object is confusing between whether you are
actually sending a request or are mocking a request.

Rename all entries of the requests object to requests_mock.

This cleans up a couple of entries where the older register_uri format
was being used in favour of using the HTTP method as the requests_mock
method.

Change-Id: Ib992c97b168011b957804df3f23dc7e3962d5734
'}]
commit_message:
Rename requests mock object in testing

It has been mentioned a number of times that the self.requests naming
for the requests_mock object is confusing between whether you are
actually sending a request or are mocking a request.

Rename all entries of the requests object to requests_mock.

This cleans up a couple of entries where the older register_uri format
was being used in favour of using the HTTP method as the requests_mock
method.

Change-Id: Ib992c97b168011b957804df3f23dc7e3962d5734

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-20 06:26:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/api_samples/os-hide-server-addresses/server-get-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-hide-server-addresses/server-get-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/test_api_samples.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-hide-server-addresses/servers-details-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_samples/os-hide-server-addresses/servers-details-resp.json.tpl'], 'message': 'Fix V2 hide server address functional tests

In V2 hide server address extension functional tests, created instance
state does not belong to configured hide server address state. Due to
that address never got hidden from server.

Sample files used in those tests are wrong which makes those tests
pass.

This patch fix the tests by overriding the conf value and fix the
sample files accordingly.

Change-Id: I60e502941bb4b2634a542ead02465a186a22d9ae
'}]
commit_message:
Fix V2 hide server address functional tests

In V2 hide server address extension functional tests, created instance
state does not belong to configured hide server address state. Due to
that address never got hidden from server.

Sample files used in those tests are wrong which makes those tests
pass.

This patch fix the tests by overriding the conf value and fix the
sample files accordingly.

Change-Id: I60e502941bb4b2634a542ead02465a186a22d9ae

commit_message:
Secure boot support for iscsi_ilo driver

This patch implements secure boot support for iscsi_ilo driver.

Node power off step has been moved from deploy() to first step
in prepare() stage. The rational is:-
If iLO is in POST state, then it would not accept any RIBCL
commands related to boot mode changes. This could lead to deploy
failure.

Implements: blueprint uefi-secure-boot
Change-Id: Ie5813592496665d8fdb48270227be4b06cbf5570

commit_message:
Add support for HP Vertica datastore in Trove

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

The following features have been implemented in this patchset:
- Launch/Reboot/Terminate
- Included unit tests.

Workflow for building instance is as follows:
- Guest instance is booted using taskmanager.
- Once the guest instance is active in nova,
  it receives "prepare" message.
- Mount the data disk on device_path.
- Check if vertica packages have been installed,
  install_if_needed().
- Run Vertica pre-install test, prepare_for_install_vertica().
- Run install_vertica command to install and
  configure Vertica, install_vertica().
- Create a database named db_srvr, create_db().

New Files:
- A new directory, vertica, has been created for manager code
  under guestagent/datastore/experimental.
- test_vertica_manager.py contains the unit-tests
  for vertica-manager.

Change-Id: I30bc4fd597d30c817bf0a8adc1109ca1f6495096
Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Converted common files in the End User Guide

1. DocBook to RST conversion of common content in the End User Guide:
- Create and manage networks
- Discover the version number for a client
- Manage images
- Manage volumes
- Set environment variables using the OpenStack RC file.

2. Added files to the toctree in cli.rst

Change-Id: I1ab28fa36c408a51b818cdcc6b81364c2ba8b52e

commit_message:
Allow to request metadata proxy only from internal interfaces

Currently the metadata service can be requested on 169.254.169.254:80
from all interfaces including external interfaces. This change updates
PREROUTING rules to allow request on 169.254.169.254:80 only from
internal interfaces.

Change-Id: I44a9e03992f9e2a7bd4d798ae69d8aa7d75d3078
Closes-Bug: #1187102

subject: Added some test cases for node operations (engine)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 14:53:20.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/common/utils.py', 'senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/engine/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/tests/engine/test_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Added some test cases for node operations (engine)

Also fixed some errors in engine and test cases:
- creating node with cluster of different project is not possible,
  because the cluster cannot be found in current context;
- dummy context used in testing does not contain a project id for
  checking, this has to be added.
- flaws in cluster test cases are preventing some tests to actually test
  anything.

Change-Id: I77d9bbb2fb8ee3b4335cc71bb6a6f5bb219d75d1
'}]
commit_message:
Added some test cases for node operations (engine)

Also fixed some errors in engine and test cases:
- creating node with cluster of different project is not possible,
  because the cluster cannot be found in current context;
- dummy context used in testing does not contain a project id for
  checking, this has to be added.
- flaws in cluster test cases are preventing some tests to actually test
  anything.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-05 13:30:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py'], 'message': "VMware: Fix disk UUID in instance's extra config

During volume attach, the UUID of volume's virtual disk
is saved in instance's extra config. The virtual disk is
searched by volume's UUID assuming that the disk name
contains volume's UUID. But this assumption may not be
true always. Once the instance is migrated with an attached
volume, the volume's vmdk name changes after volume detach.
This patch fixes the problem by using the disk device info
of volume instead of searching the virtual disk by volume
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic3a249dff65e9abafe3986789607a855df4e8481
Closes-Bug: #1419474
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix disk UUID in instance's extra config

During volume attach, the UUID of volume's virtual disk
is saved in instance's extra config. The virtual disk is
searched by volume's UUID assuming that the disk name
contains volume's UUID. But this assumption may not be
true always. Once the instance is migrated with an attached
volume, the volume's vmdk name changes after volume detach.
This patch fixes the problem by using the disk device info
of volume instead of searching the virtual disk by volume
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic3a249dff65e9abafe3986789607a855df4e8481
Closes-Bug: #1419474

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-09 19:01:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Make scenario tests requiring admin skip if no admin creds

Some scenario tests will fail if there are no admin creds. This commit removes
the creation of an admin client from the setup of the ScenarioTest class
and puts that code in the subclasses that need it, along with a check to skip
if no admin creds are available.

One such class was the unused OrchestrationScenarioTest which was removed.
Future heat scenario tests will go in the heat project.

Change-Id: Ib0b82510200e927a391576686e0a78c4c4b6cd34
'}]
commit_message:
Make scenario tests requiring admin skip if no admin creds

Some scenario tests will fail if there are no admin creds. This commit removes
the creation of an admin client from the setup of the ScenarioTest class
and puts that code in the subclasses that need it, along with a check to skip
if no admin creds are available.

One such class was the unused OrchestrationScenarioTest which was removed.
Future heat scenario tests will go in the heat project.

Change-Id: Ib0b82510200e927a391576686e0a78c4c4b6cd34

subject: Add matchmaker rings for OpenStack projects
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-05 02:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['etc/matchmaker/oslo_matchmaker_ring.json.sample', 'etc/matchmaker/README.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add matchmaker rings for OpenStack projects

This json file is necessary for ZeroMQ matchmaker_ring driver.
When using matchmaker_ring, this file needs to be modified to
reflect the real hostname of each machine running ZeroMQ driver.
You must identify the destination of each topic.

By the way, the devstack support also needs it to be included
in the oslo_messaging repo.

It is noted that it is really hard to identify all the topics for
each service. What I choose here is the open-to-public services
in the www.openstack.org/software.

Also, it will be continuously updated.

Change-Id: I0d8bd863a45e3275abaecdd612f1462e13eb7d7b
'}]
commit_message:
Add matchmaker rings for OpenStack projects

This json file is necessary for ZeroMQ matchmaker_ring driver.
When using matchmaker_ring, this file needs to be modified to
reflect the real hostname of each machine running ZeroMQ driver.
You must identify the destination of each topic.

By the way, the devstack support also needs it to be included
in the oslo_messaging repo.

It is noted that it is really hard to identify all the topics for
each service. What I choose here is the open-to-public services
in the www.openstack.org/software.

Also, it will be continuously updated.

Change-Id: I0d8bd863a45e3275abaecdd612f1462e13eb7d7b

gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops sometimes fail due to too many rpc.call
for this job. A reply to nova compute is always delayed and

commit_message:
Increase rpc_response_timeout

gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops sometimes fail due to too many rpc.call
for this job. A reply to nova compute is always delayed and
finally causes timeout.

It is suggested to increase the default rpc_response_timeout for
rpc client in large-scale deployment.

This modification is totally safe.

Change-Id: Ida59edac58327bcf516c50f09f0735e5220ab5b4
Closes-Bug: #1415236

commit_message:
Add rpc_response_time option

According to different scales of deployments, the default
rpc_response_time value may not work. During some large-ops
tests, RPC timeout always occurs.

Adding this option provides convenience to adjust it.

Change-Id: I36748c9d28bf928c5751f82d298314c65b7ada1a

If state_path variable is configured with a final '/' on path, then
mount_path variable is created with wrong syntax. This causes

This patch proposes to fix the aforementioned problem by checking

"}]
commit_message:
Fixing mount when state_path is configured with a final '/'

If state_path variable is configured with a final '/' on path, then
mount_path variable is created with wrong syntax. This causes
a failure when the c-vol process tries to mount the filesystem.

This patch proposes to fix the aforementioned problem by checking
the validity of the mount point and fixing the mount point in case
it has an incorrect value.

Closes-bug: 1425551

Change-Id: I9fe50fe07953fb5e94da467a7446528e5030e41b

commit_message:
Update unique constraint of compute_nodes with deleted column

After a service deleted, the corresponding compute node entry will be
soft-deleted also. But we can't startup this compute node again, because
when create new entry for this compute node, the current compute_nodes table's
unique constraint was violated.

This patch adds 'deleted' column into unique constraint to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I71ca360df629a4df71892e8595d3ef1707f8d115
Closes-Bug: #1418298

commit_message:
network: Fix another IPv6 test for Mac

Commit 713767660ba44421ea5e0406d121ea868ad178ac skipped some tests on a Mac
that would fail because OSX doesn't stringify IPv6 addresses properly.

This test was missed, so adding it now.

Change-Id: Ic173b68f2c8cbdd621456a79b242e9be11f2c30f
Related-Bug: 1409135

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 09:57:00.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/angular/services/hz.api.policy.js', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/angular/horizon.js'], 'message': 'Global error HTTP handler

Currently in angular, we are using ajax to make various REST api calls. When
a user session expires, there is no way to know this.  Consequently, when
the user attempt to do something a 401 is returned.

Instead of checking for this 401 in all of our REST invocation, it is best to do
a global error check for 401. If this happen, we log the user out and redirect
the user to the login screen.

In addition, policy alerts will now auto dismiss.

Partially Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

Change-Id: I427977b9cf7eeee928e1ade9355954bbb385170c
'}]
commit_message:
Global error HTTP handler

Currently in angular, we are using ajax to make various REST api calls. When
a user session expires, there is no way to know this.  Consequently, when
the user attempt to do something a 401 is returned.

Instead of checking for this 401 in all of our REST invocation, it is best to do
a global error check for 401. If this happen, we log the user out and redirect
the user to the login screen.

In addition, policy alerts will now auto dismiss.

Partially Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

Change-Id: I427977b9cf7eeee928e1ade9355954bbb385170c

commit_message:
Use iteration instead of list(s) when extracting scopes

Instead of creating a temporary list(s) during scope extraction
just use a generator/iterator instead to avoid the need to
create temporary and wasteful list(s) that are not really needed.

Change-Id: Ia7f2c36c2cbd6602b90bd32911fc1ff5bcbb1611

commit_message:
Expose the storage backend being used

To match how the persistence connections
provide access to there backend it seems
appropriate to also have the storage layer
provide the same property so that users of
it can easily access the underlying backend
object (if they so need to).

Change-Id: I8fdb5e7efc66bba93da2949bb6adad534bf3b127

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-11 20:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/glance_keystone_auth_spec.rb', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': "Fix catalog compilation when not configuring endpoint

Previously when you set $configure_endpoint to false and did not have a
keystone_endpoint resource with the same name as is defined by
glance::keystone::auth, the catalog would not be compiled. This was
because a relationship was being established where one resource in the
relationship didn't exist.

This changes this so that the relationship involving the Keystone
endpoint is only defined if $configure_endpoint is set to true.

Also, the test for when $configure_endpoint is false was set to check
for an endpoint that doesn't get created even if $configure_endpoint is
true. Fixed so that it checks for an endpoint that has the correct name
(the same as when using the default values to call the class).

Change-Id: I6631a656a888d0df7ab173705bea0598bd2b2f58
Closes-Bug: 1368686
"}]
commit_message:
Fix catalog compilation when not configuring endpoint

Previously when you set $configure_endpoint to false and did not have a
keystone_endpoint resource with the same name as is defined by
glance::keystone::auth, the catalog would not be compiled. This was
because a relationship was being established where one resource in the
relationship didn't exist.

This changes this so that the relationship involving the Keystone
endpoint is only defined if $configure_endpoint is set to true.

Also, the test for when $configure_endpoint is false was set to check
for an endpoint that doesn't get created even if $configure_endpoint is
true. Fixed so that it checks for an endpoint that has the correct name
(the same as when using the default values to call the class).

Change-Id: I6631a656a888d0df7ab173705bea0598bd2b2f58
Closes-Bug: 1368686

commit_message:

rally.exceptions.RallyException is a base class for all exceptions.
This class should not be raisen in code.

Closes-Bug: #1431879

commit_message:
Add breakpoint support

This covers most of the features specified in:

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/heat-specs/specs/juno/stack-breakpoint.html

The breakpoints are specified via hooks in the stack's environment.

The only thing missing from the blueprint is stepping through a stack.

Partial-Blueprint: stack-breakpoint
Change-Id: Iddc019464484af18ca6f21f11660649e30d63aca

subject: Properly escape grep expression
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 22:28:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/type_set.pp'], 'message': "Properly escape grep expression

When using cinder::type_set it checks for existence by listing them all
them trying to match against the output. Unfortunately this is broken
because the \b word boundary expression needs to be escaped so puppet
doesn't turn it into a backspace.

Change-Id: I30de455a995be0663ccf7c2c07f777fb5559d8a1
"}]
commit_message:
Properly escape grep expression

When using cinder::type_set it checks for existence by listing them all
them trying to match against the output. Unfortunately this is broken
because the \b word boundary expression needs to be escaped so puppet
doesn't turn it into a backspace.

Change-Id: I30de455a995be0663ccf7c2c07f777fb5559d8a1

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-03-11 13:08:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix where compute node is deleted and re-added

We need to catch ComputeHostNotFound in the update_available_resources
periodic task such that it doesn't bomb out the full task. We should
probably catch any exception just so the loop doesn't bomb out and stop
updating resources for other nodes.

Also: Re-order querying available nodes from the driver and selecting
all compute nodes from the DB to avoid potential race conditions.

Change-Id: I963a22001b00e0aa873e66033098bb2d1a17f111
Closes-bug: 1352510
"}]
commit_message:
Fix where compute node is deleted and re-added

We need to catch ComputeHostNotFound in the update_available_resources
periodic task such that it doesn't bomb out the full task. We should
probably catch any exception just so the loop doesn't bomb out and stop
updating resources for other nodes.

Also: Re-order querying available nodes from the driver and selecting
all compute nodes from the DB to avoid potential race conditions.

Change-Id: I963a22001b00e0aa873e66033098bb2d1a17f111
Closes-bug: 1352510

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 14:09:25.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': "Fix catalog compilation when not configuring endpoint

Previously when you set $configure_endpoint to false and did not have a
keystone_endpoint resource with the same name as is defined by
nova::keystone::auth, the catalog would not be compiled. This was
because a relationship was being established where one resource in the
relationship didn't exist.

This changes this so that the relationship involving the Keystone
endpoint is only defined if $configure_endpoint is set to true.

Change-Id: Ief2ea40d0e4f31e18ba4b1230c5879909a1cfe46
Closes-Bug: 1368686
"}]
commit_message:
Fix catalog compilation when not configuring endpoint

Previously when you set $configure_endpoint to false and did not have a
keystone_endpoint resource with the same name as is defined by
nova::keystone::auth, the catalog would not be compiled. This was
because a relationship was being established where one resource in the
relationship didn't exist.

This changes this so that the relationship involving the Keystone
endpoint is only defined if $configure_endpoint is set to true.

Change-Id: Ief2ea40d0e4f31e18ba4b1230c5879909a1cfe46
Closes-Bug: 1368686

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

- This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
  puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some just
  catch common errors.

Change-Id: I5f5859ab24c4d5f2f0b3737303ece9ddcb70927f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Fixup CSV parsing from the openstack client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-12 21:57:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'Fixup CSV parsing from the openstack client

Previously this was looking for lines that begin with double quotes, but
that caused issues with CSV lines that have embedded newlines.
Additionally, some versions of openstack client emit \r\n instead of \n
with CSV output, which breaks parsing the end of the output.

This changes the parsing of the output to check if the output starts
with a double quote, and if not, strip everything up until the first
double quote after a line end.

Change-Id: I479f5dbedb7bac1f01098ef738e8b33248452fe9
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup CSV parsing from the openstack client

Previously this was looking for lines that begin with double quotes, but
that caused issues with CSV lines that have embedded newlines.
Additionally, some versions of openstack client emit \r\n instead of \n
with CSV output, which breaks parsing the end of the output.

This changes the parsing of the output to check if the output starts
with a double quote, and if not, strip everything up until the first
double quote after a line end.

Change-Id: I479f5dbedb7bac1f01098ef738e8b33248452fe9

commit_message:
Get data source information in Horizon by id

* congress.py: Use new congressclient functions. New function to get the
  columns names for a policy table. Change data source functions to identify
  the data source by id instead of name, matching congressclient changes. Keep
  function to get data source by name, needed for the plugin-derviced policy
  tables.

datasources/
* tables.py: Use data source id in links. Move table name to first column.
  Remove owner id, which was removed as a data source property, and add driver.
* urls.py: Use data source id in URLs. Rename data source table name keyword
  arg for clarity.
* views.py: Get data source info by id. Use schema to name columns in policy
  tables.

datasources/templates/datasources/
* _detail_overview.html: Shorten title.

policies/templates/policies/
* _detail_overview.html: Add description and kind properties.

Change-Id: Ia186f95c76ca58c113d51fb736b64ab67122f260

commit_message:
Improve styling for security group detail table

In the Access and Security step of the new Launch Instance Wizard,
there is a detail table that shows when expanding the security groups.
Currently this detail table is very compact/congested and uses table
striping, which does not match the mockups. This patch removes table
striping from the security group details table, and adds padding so
that it more closely matches the mockups.

Closes-Bug: 1433688
Change-Id: Iccd4a83cb3c7e36383f6063cb65d9e7c4efe84b1

commit_message:
Call partprobe+partx before writing configdrive

partx -u $DEVICE doesn't work in some cases, but partprobe $DEVICE fails
in virtual environments (like devstack). For now, run both commands and
ignore partprobe failures.

Moving forward, this shell should be factored into python and share code
with the other partition-modifying code added this cycle.

Change-Id: I7e4c010e260be2a23dcc894bc0c1b30aea949084
Partial-bug: 1433812

This commit changes all the uses of the old AdminManager and Manager()
constructs to use cls.isolated_creds to provide user credentials from
whatever the configured credential provider is being used instead of
assuming it's the non-locking accounts provider without an accounts.yaml
file. As part of this we need to add a heat option for the stack owner
role so that we can request the creds by that role. The heat tests were
previously making an implicit assumption about the configured user having
that role assigned. Which while true in devstack today, it isn't
necessarily the case everywhere.

Closes-Bug: #1433723
Change-Id: Ie071cb2cb6add591a60c9d76a12c95b7fb5ee539
"}]
commit_message:
Respect configured credential provider everywhere

This commit changes all the uses of the old AdminManager and Manager()
constructs to use cls.isolated_creds to provide user credentials from
whatever the configured credential provider is being used instead of
assuming it's the non-locking accounts provider without an accounts.yaml
file. As part of this we need to add a heat option for the stack owner
role so that we can request the creds by that role. The heat tests were
previously making an implicit assumption about the configured user having
that role assigned. Which while true in devstack today, it isn't
necessarily the case everywhere.

Depends-On: Id98a83f0a716de0fdb5f36d03407364830e8fa5f
Closes-Bug: #1433723
Change-Id: Ie071cb2cb6add591a60c9d76a12c95b7fb5ee539

commit_message:
Add minimum qemu-img version check functions

Functions for retrieving the qemu-img version and validate it
against driver specific requirements are added to imageutils.

This way, duplicated code can be removed in a following patch
from volume drivers that require it.

Change-Id: Ic0808863bd95c7ee84751a27d7a4eabc613f8d58

commit_message:
Fix manage operation in generic driver

Recently was added support of manage/unmanage functionality to generic driver.
See change: I8767a7af75d575c57e8708563fa4a6bf2f4aa8ad

Changes here should had been included to mentioned commit, but were not by
mistake. Without this change manage/unmanage functionality does not work
using generic driver.

Closes-Bug: #1433973
